loans.name: Sarim

texts.en: Sarim, 30, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in the agricultural business for over 15 years, have extensive experience and are successful in their career. They are involved in growing rice and fattening up cattle. They earn approximately USD 3 per day. Additionally, her husband works as a construction worker and earns about USD 4 per day. Due to the lack of funds, Sarim is requesting for a loan of USD 700 to purchase fertilizer, fuel and pesticides to use in her farming work. In the future, she would like to expand her agricultural business and help her children get Bachelor degrees.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, fuel, and pesticides to use in her farming work

loans.name: Eunice Maria

texts.es:
Doña Eunice sigue laborando en Aduana, para el bienestar comun de su familia, junto a su esposo han venido mejorando su vivienda, para una mejor seguridad y comodidad, el trabaja en transporte y sus pequeños hijos cursando el años escolar.
Eunice ha hecho su cocina, en donde ha avanzado mucho, al terminar todos los detalles, ahora quiere poner ceramica en la cocina  y cambiar techo de un cuarto, para gozar sus mejorias. Comprara materiales  en laminas de zinc, perlines, golosos, ceramica, cemento bonx, separadores, para comenzar su obra.
texts.en:
Doña Eunice works in the Customs Administration for the shared well-being of her family. She has been improving her dwelling with her husband, and now they enjoy more security and comfort. Her husband works in the transportation sector and her young children are enrolled in school.

Eunice has renovated her kitchen. She has done most of the work except finishing the details. Now she wants to put ceramics in the kitchen and replace the ceiling of a room, and finally enjoy the improvements.  She will buy sheets of zinc, stone shards, pins, ceramics, Bonx cement and separators to start the work.

loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to put ceramics in the kitchen and replace the ceiling of a room.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy Panadol, emzoron and pinoplex syrup.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en: Sophal, 39, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in the agricultural business for over 20 years, have extensive experience and are successful in their career. They are involved in growing rice and vegetables to sell. They earn approximately USD 6 per day. Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Sophal is requesting a loan of USD 1,100 to purchase a motorbike for commuting, as well as carrying vegetables to sell at the market. In the future, she would like to help her children get Bachelor degrees and rebuild her present house to make it bigger and stronger to provide convenient living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting and carrying vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bags of onions and rubber oil to sell.

loans.name: Florance

texts.en:
Florance is 52 years old. She is blessed with three children aged 19, four and three years, respectively. She owns a wine and spirits shop, a business she started four years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 60,000. 

She has requested a loan worth KES 20,000 to purchase three dozen of mericane and two dozen of napoleon. Profit from her business will help her purchase additional stock and pay school fees. 

Her dream is to buy a plot and build rental houses. This is her first loan.

loans.use: to buy stock for her wine and spirits shop

loans.name: Felix Ruben

texts.es: La señor Rubén es casado tiene 2 hijos se dedica a la venta de DVDs en un acalle muy concurrida de la ciudad de El Alto, se dedica a esta actividad hace mas de dos años, es casado y su esposa trabaja como recepcionista  en una empresa privada, quien también ayuda con los gastos del hogar, y algunas veces   también esta con la actividad de albañil contratista, pero en esta actividad trabaja solo  cuando tiene contratos el sr. Rubén es cliente antiguo de la institución, en esta ocasión solicita el  crédito para la compra de un televisor para su negocio ya que esto le permitir brindar un mejor servicio a su clientes que le compran los DVDs haciendo la prueba, el Sr. Rubén es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecido por la oportunidad que le brindaron.
texts.en:
Rubén is married and has two children. He makes a living selling DVDs on a well trafficked street in the city of El Alto. He has made a living at this for more than two years. He is married and his wife works as a receptionist at a private company, which also helps with the household expenses. Rubén also works as a construction contractor sometimes, but he only does that when he has contracts. 

Rubén is a long time client of the institution. This time he is requesting a loan to purchase a television for his business. This will allow him to offer better service to his customers so they will buys DVDs as they will be able to test them out. 

Rubén is a very hardworking man. He is happy and grateful for the opportunity he has been given.

loans.use: to buy a television to use in DVD sales.

loans.name: Rosa Virginia

texts.es:
Doña Rosa, tiene la edad de 48 años, trabaja como afanadora , es madre soltera de tres hijos, hoy en dia mayores y trabajando. Para ella el mejoramiento de su casa, ha sido su pioridad, pero por recursos economicos ah abanzado poco.
Mejoro el cambio del techo ya con financiamiento, el cual goza de esta mejora que le perjudicaba en invierno, hoy con este nuevo prestamo podra hacer divisiones en los cuartos de concreto, teniendo mejor comodidad y privacidad para su familia. comprara materiales de construccion en bloques, hierro, cemento, arena y comezar la obra.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa is 48 and works as a cleaner. She is a single mother of three children, who are all working adults nowadays. Rosa’s priority has been to make improvements to her house, however due to scare financial resources she has made little headway. She has already used a loan to change her roof, thereby avoiding harm in the winter. 

Today with this new loan she will be able to make room divisions from concrete, thus affording more comfort and privacy to her family. She will buy construction materials such as concrete blocks, iron, cement and sand and begin the work.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build room divisions and achieve privacy and comfort in her home.

loans.name: Dina Rosario

texts.es: La señora  Dina es cliente nueva, soltera vive en la ciudad de La Paz, ella tiene una imprenta, donde realiza todo tipo de trabajos en cuanto a invitaciones para matrimonios, bautizos, prestes y todo tipo de acontecimientos sociales, su imprenta esta ubicado en una zona muy estratégica de la ciudad,  realiza el trabajo de acuerdo al pedido del cliente,  el préstamo lo  invertirá  en comprar material para trabajos que tiene que entregar  la cliente se  compromete en pagar de manera puntual sus cuotas a emprender, ya que es una persona joven emprendedora con ganas de superación se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Dina is a new client. She is single and lives in the city of La Paz. She has a printing shop where she takes all kinds of order such as wedding invitations, baptisms, presentations and all kinds of social events. Her printing shop is located in a very strategic area of the city. She carries out her work per her customer's orders.

She will invest this loan in the purchase of materials for jobs she must fulfill for her customers. She is committed to making her payments punctually and diligently. She is an entrepreneurial young woman with a desire to get ahead. She is happy and grateful to the institution for the support it has given her.

loans.use: to buy wholesale materials for her printing shop.

loans.name: Lupe

texts.es: La señora   Lupe es cliente antigua de la institución en sus anteriores créditos demostró   responsabilidad  y puntualidad en el pago de sus cuotas la cliente vive en   la ciudad de La Paz, zona Los Andes, Lupe es casada  y tiene dos hijos que están en la edad escolar, la cliente  vende ropa para niños desde hace varios años, el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de  ropa escolar para niños por estas épocas ya que estan iniciando las labores escolares y también para la compra de artículos para carnavales,  ya que estas épocas la cliente tiene mucha venta,  la cliente se siente muy feliz por ser beneficiada con el crédito y agradecida con la institución ya que este es un apoyo para salir adelante mejorar sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Señora Lupe is an long time client of Emprender.  Through her previous loans, she demonstrated responsibility and punctuality in her payments.  She lives in the city of La Paz in the Los Andes zone.  She is married and has two school-aged children.  She has sold children's clothing for several years.  She will invest this loan in the purchase of school clothing for children since they are starting school right now.  She will also buy items for Carnaval.  She has a lot of sales right now.  She is very happy about receiving this loan and is thankful to the Emprender.  This is supporting her to get ahead and to increase her income and therefore her quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of school clothing and products for Carnaval.

loans.name: Maria Senelia

texts.es:
Maria Senelia es casada, tiene 4 hijos: los 2 mayores trabajan y apoyan a sus padres con los gastos y los 2 menores estudian la secundaria. El esposo de doña Maria trabaja como guarda de seguridad y le apoya con los gastos del hogar. Doña Maria Senelia trabaja como empleada domestica para el cyber Villanueva desde hace mas de 17 años, ganandose la confianza, cariño y el respeto de esta familia que en todo momento la apoyan.  

Maria esta solicitando su 5to credito con el objetivo de seguir mejorando su vivienda, y espera seguir contando con el apoyo a kiva,pues con el credito anterior logro levantar la tapia que tenia proyectada.  Ahora desea poder construir un cuarto anexo a su casa para que sus hijos cuenten con mayor comodidad y privacidad.
texts.en:
Maria Senelia is married and has four children.  The two oldest work and support their parents with the home's expenses.  The two youngest are in secondary school.  Her husband works as a security guard and helps her with the home's expenses.  Maria Senelia has worked as a domestic employee for the Villanueva for 17 years, gaining the confidence, care, and respect of this family that always supports her.

Maria is requesting her fifth loan with the objective of improving her home.  She hopes to continue having the support of Kiva.  With her previous loan, she was able to build the wall that she had planned.  Now she hopes to build a room attached to her house so her children can have more comfort and privacy.

loans.use: to build a room onto her home.

loans.name: Genaro Daniel

texts.es:
Genaro es un hombre que tiene un pequeño de 9 años y disfruta mucho de ver películas con su hijo y su esposa. Él siempre se ha esmerado por poder salir adelante, pero por motivos personales no pudo estudiar lo que deseaba “Mecánica”, pero con el tiempo y dedicación pudo encontrar un pequeño negocio, estaba decidido salir adelante y demostrarse que podría mantener y cuidar de su pequeña familia.

Actualmente Genaro tiene 2 empleos uno que consiste en el transporte público y al otro, al cual le dedica mayor tiempo, es a la venta de animales, esta actividad la realiza la mayor parte del día y realiza ventas mensuales a sus clientes, él sabe que su negocio tiene éxito porque aprendió a fidelizar a sus clientes y así mismo logró que ellos pudiesen recomendarlos.

Con ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva, Genaro podrá realizar la compra de muchos más animales para vender. Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación logrará su gran sueño: “Tener un gran ganado” y construir su casa propia mediante sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Genaro is a man who has a nine-year-old son and who really enjoys watching movies with his son and wife.  He has always done his best to get ahead, but for personal reasons, he couldn't study to become a mechanic like he wanted to.  But with time and dedication, he was able to start a small business.  He was determined to get ahead and to demonstrate that he could support and take care of his small family.

Currently, Genaro has two jobs, one is in public transportation, and the other, to which he dedicates the most time, is selling animals.  He does this for most of the day and makes monthly sales to his customers.  He knows that his business is successful because he learned to gain the loyalty of his customers, and they are recommending him to others.

With the help of the Kiva lenders, Genaro will be able to purchase many more animals to sell.  With a lot of effort and dedication, he will accomplish his biggest dream:  to have a lot of livestock and to build his home with his income.

loans.use: to purchase animals.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La señora Verónica de 37 años de edad, es Casada y 2 hijos menores que van a la escuela. Ella nos cuenta que antes de empezar con el negocio estudió cursos de peluquería y manicura, y una vez culminado dichos estudios decidió montar en su casa una peluquería. Comenta que con la ayuda de su marido pudo juntar un capital y así poder contar con herramientas de trabajo, gracias a la buena atención y a la amabilidad obtuvo una gran aceptación y con ello muchos clientes hasta la actualidad.
La razón de su trabajo son sus hijos, es por ellos que ella se esfuerza siempre para poder darles lo que necesitan para una vida digna y sin privaciones.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de shampoo, enjuagues, cremas, esmaltes y demás insumos indispensables para su peluquería, ya que desea poder seguir trabajando en ella, y sabe que la única forma de hacerlo es invertir en su negocio.
texts.en:
Verónica is 37 years old, married and has two children who are minors and go to school. She tells us that before starting her business she studied courses in hairdressing and manicuring. Once she finished those courses she decided to start a beauty salon in her home. She says that with the help of her husband she was able to get together some capital and acquire the tools for her work. Thanks to her good attention and friendliness she was well received. As a result she has had a lot of clients up to now. 

She works for her children. It is for them that she always works hard in order to give them what they need to have a dignified life without lacking anything.

She is requesting this loan to buy shampoo, conditioner, creams, nail polish and other necessary supplies for her beauty salon. She hopes to be able to continue working in the salon and she knows that the only way to do this is to invest in her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Adonay Group

texts.es:
El grupo Adonay lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas Perla Marina la cual hace 22 años inicio su pulpería con la venta de chiverías actualmente vende de todo un poco desde granos básicos, carne, pollo, perecederos, productos de limpieza y cosméticos  en los cuales invertirá el crédito.
Las otras integrantes son Miriam del Carmen se dedica al comercio de cosméticos y Scarleth quien tiene una vulcanización.
texts.en: The Adonay group is made up of three hard-working and enterprising women.  One of them is Perla Marina, who started her small grocery store 22 years ago by selling dairy products.  Today she sells a little bit of everything including basic grains, meat, chicken, perishables, cleaning products, and cosmetics.  She will invest the loan in the purchase of these products.  The other members of the group are Miriam del Carmen, who sells cosmetics, and Scarleth, who has a tire repair shop.

loans.use: to buy basic grains

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es una madre de familia de 53 años de edad, sus hijos son mayores e independientes económicamente, tiene su propio domicilio el cual esta ubicado en el caserío rural de nombre “El Pintor II” en el distrito de Jayanca, donde sus pobladores están dedicados a la ganadería y agricultura específicamente.

Margarita adquirió los conocimientos de sus padres en cuanto al negocio de venta de ganado, entre ellos el ovino, caprino, vacuno y además aves de corral, negocio que actualmente ella tiene como principal actividad económica, para el sustento de su hogar, ah dicha actividad se dedica un aproximado de 5 años, los cuales le han servido para establecerse con su propia clientela en todos los caseríos aledaños al suyo.

Uno de sus objetivos es incrementar su capital de trabajo para poder abastecer a todos sus clientes, por lo que esta solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 1000 Nuevos Soles los cuales le servirán para la compra de ganado lo que le permitirá aumentar sus ingresos con los que mejorará su calidad de vida.

Margarita es cliente recurrente en nuestra institución por lo que se le conoce por su responsabilidad en cuanto a sus pagos.
texts.en:
Margarita is a 53-year-old mother. Her children are of age and financially independent. She owns her own home, which is located in a rural neighborhood called "El Pintor II" in the Jayanca district. The residents there make their living specifically in livestock and agriculture.

Margarita learned the business of livestock sales from her parents, specifically sheep, cows and goat, as well as poultry. This business is now her main source of income. She has made her living this way for approximately five years in which time she has established a customer base in all of the nearby neighborhoods. 

One of her goals is to increase her capital to be able to supply all of her customers. For this reason she is requesting a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa. She will use this to buy livestock which will allow her to increase her income and improve her quality of life.

Margarita is a recurring client of our institution. As a result her responsibility in making her payments is well known.

loans.use: to buy livestock (cows, sheep, and goats)

loans.name: Obdulia

texts.es:
La Sra. Obdulia tiene 54 años de edad, es soltera, tiene hijos, quienes son todos mayores ya, ella vive en la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso.
La Sra. Obdulia se dedica a la venta de ropas, calzados, artículos de mercería hace aproximadamente 30 años. Realiza sus ventas en forma ambulante, visitando casa por casa a sus clientes. Gracias al tiempo que lleva en lo que hace ha podido formarse un buena clientela que siempre acude a ella.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de vaqueros, remeras, calzados, uniformes escolares, a fin de aprovechar el inicio de clases en las escuelas y colegios. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que le están dando.
texts.en:
Obdulia is 54 years old. She has children who are all adults now. She lives in the city of Mariano Roque Alphonso. Obdulia has been selling clothing, shoes, and sewing supplies for approximately 30 years.

She sells door to door, visiting her customers house by house. Thanks to the time she has spent doing what she does, she has been able to to establish a good list of customers who always come to her. 

She is applying for the loan to buy jeans, T-shirts, shoes, and school uniforms, to take advantage of the start of classes in the schools and high schools. She is thankful to the Foundation and to Kiva for the opportunity they are giving her.

loans.use: To buy articles of clothing for later sale.

loans.name: Buen Pastor Group

texts.es:
El grupo el buen Pastor lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Isabel  quien se dedica al comercio de comida y verduras desde hace 20 años negocios en el que invertirá el crédito con la compra de mercadería. Ella con el crédito anterior logro mejorar su casa y comparase una computadora ya que vende disco también.
Las otras integrantes son Damaris quien vende recarga desde hace 2 años y Melida Rosa tiene una pulpería desde hace 4 años.
texts.en:
The "Buen Pastor" (Good Pastor) group is made up of three hard-working and enterprising people.  One of them is Isabel, who has made a living selling food and vegetables for 20 years.  She will invest the loan in the purchase of merchandise.  With her previous credit, she was able to make improvements to her home and buy a computer since she also sells CDs.

The other members of the group are Damaris, who has sold mobile phone credit for two years, and Melida Rosa, who has had a small grocery store for 4 years.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, perishables, meat, etc.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hansel Y Grethel Group

texts.es:
El grupo Hansel y Grethel lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Francisca del Socorro quien vende comida y desayunos desde hace 2 años. Ella con las ganancias obtenidas logro mejorar su casa y comprarse un exhibidor de gaseosas.
Las otras integrantes son Darlinck de 37 años quien tiene una pulpería desde hace 6 años y Ignacia del Carmen quien tiene una fritanga desde hace 6 años.
texts.en:
The Hansel and Grethel group is made up of three hardworking and entrepreneurial women. One of these is Francisca del Socorro who has sold food and breakfasts for two years. With the profits she has made she was able to improve her home and purchase a display case for sodas.

The other members are Darlinck, who is 37 years old and has had a small grocery store for six years, and Ignacia del Carmen, who has had a small restaurant for six years.

loans.use: to buy staple grains, meat, eggs, bread, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Saturdaymah

texts.en:
Staurdaymah  is 28 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and her husband is a driver. The couple has two children, ages 5 months and 13 years. The oldest is in school. For the past two years, Staurdaymah  has been selling goods such as pepper, bitter ball, okra, and oil at the local market.

Staurdaymah  is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper, bitter ball, okra and oil. In the future, she plans to become a big businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase pepper, bitter ball, okra, and oil to sell

loans.name: Camino Al Exito Group

texts.es: La Nueva Alcancía Comunal “Camino al Éxito”  es un grupo conformado por 07 mujeres emprendedoras que tienen en común mejorar cada día, siendo la  Sra. María una de las integrantes. Ella es separada con 02 hijas mayores de edad, actualmente se dedica a la venta  de bebidas como cervezas, agua mineral y gaseosas, este negocio nació con la idea de contar con un negocio propio pues sabía que de esta manera tendría mayores  ganancias, como actividad segundaria se dedica a la crianza de animales (cuyes, pollo, patos) . María se siente orgullosa pues gracias a su esfuerzo y perseverancia les ha brindado educación a sus hijas, y actualmente apoya a su nieta con su educación. A sus 67 años María asegura sentirse con todas las fuerzas de seguir trabajando. El crédito que solicito lo va invertir en su negocio comprando gaseosas, agua mineral y cervezas, y así tener que ofrecer a sus clientes. La Nueva Alcancía Comunal “Camino al Éxito” agradecen el crédito brindado.
texts.en: The new communal bank “Camino al Exito”  (Road to Success) is made up of 7 entrepreneurial women who each day want to get ahead, and  María is one of the members.  She is separated, has 2 adult daughters, and currently sells drinks such as beer, mineral water and soft drinks.  This business was born from the idea of having her own business because she knew that in this way, she would get more income.  Her other work is raising livestock (guinea pigs, chickens, ducks).  María is proud that thanks to her effort and perseverance she has been able to educate her daughters and she is also now helping her granddaughter with schooling.  At 67 María is confident that she feels comfortable with her efforts in continuing with her work.  She will use the requested loan to buy soft drinks, mineral water and beer and so have product to offer her customers.  The communal group “Camino al Exito” appreciates the financing offered them.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, mineral water and beer.

loans.name: Nazario

texts.es: El socio el Sr. Nazario; el socio continua prestando el servicio de su combi, el socio tambien continua con su actividad alterna de compra y venta de madera; El socio solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de madera al por mayor.
texts.en: This communal bank member is Mr. Nazario.  He continues to work as a public micro-bus (combi) driver.  He also continues his second job buying and selling wood.  He is requesting a loan in order to invest in the purchase of wood sold in bulk.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of wood

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: Angelica continua con su negocio y sigue elaborando y vendiendo quesos. La socia desea invertir en la compra de leche para sacar los derivados de la misma y poder sacar al por mayor quesos, quesillos, mantequilla y yogur. La socia invertira en la compra de leche al por mayor.
texts.en: Angelica is continuing with her business and is still making and selling cheese. She wants to buy milk from which she will extract the derivatives to make cheese, butter, and yoghurt. She will buy milk wholesale.

loans.use: by milk in bulk.

loans.name: Sengly

texts.en:
Sengly is 32 years old and married with two school-aged children. She lives with her husband in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been working in rubber plantations for over three years, earning approximately 6 USD per day. 

Sengly is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase black pepper seeds and other materials to cultivate black peppers to generate extra income to support the family. In the future, she would like to renovate her present house to make it bigger and stronger to provide a better living condition for her family, and help her children get bachelors degrees.

loans.use: to purchase black pepper seeds and materials to grow black pepper

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma continua con su negocio de la ganadería. La socia invierte su credito en la compra d eganados como vacas y los cria, los hace reproducir y los vende, la socia tambien vende vacas enteras a los diferentes clientes que ya la conocen. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de dos vacas tiernas.
texts.en: Norma is continuing with her livestock business. She will use her loan to by animals such as cows and breed them. She breeds them and sells them. She also sells whole cows to various clients that she knows. She is requesting a loan to buy two cows.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Sonny

texts.en:
Sonny is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Sonny is providing motorela (a motorcycle encased in a carriage with two rows of seats facing each other) or motorcycle with sidecar services. He has had this business for ten years. He requested a loan of PHP 17,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the services.

Sonny has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, he hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the services.

loans.name: Romona Herminia

texts.es: Ramona Herminia tiene 57 años de edad, el negocio al que se dedica la emprendedora es a la venta de ropa usada, este negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación donde la visita sus clientes por la calidad del servicio y de la variedad de producto que les ofrece. Este idea de emprender este negocio surge de la necesidad de sufragar los gastos de la familia y apoyar a su esposo, ya tiene años de tener este negocio sus la apoyan económicamente también. Esta emprendedora está solicitando financiamiento para la compra de variedad de pacas de ropa usada para ofrecerles a sus clientes variedad.
texts.en: Ramona Herminia is 57 years old and works selling used clothing. She has her business in her home and her customers come to her because of the quality of service and variety of products she offers. The idea of starting the business came from the need of helping with the family's expenses and supporting her husband. She has been doing this work for years and her children help support her financially, as well. This business woman is asking for a loan to buy a variety of packs of used clothing to offer variety to her customers.

loans.use: buy a variety of used clothing to offer her customers

loans.name: Yenny

texts.es:
La socia  Yenny sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “IMASUMAC II” y continua viviendo en la ciudad del Cusco y donde también realiza sus actividades económicas. 

La socia Yenny sigue en la venta de helados, comestibles y artesanía.  Con el anterior préstamo Yenny pudo incrementar el capital del negocio y obtuvo buenos beneficios como por ejemplo dar mejor educación  y alimentación a sus hijos. En esta oportunidad Yenny requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo comestibles y helados. 

La socia Yenny agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member, Yenny, still belongs to the Imasumac II Community Bank and living in the city of Cuzco where she works. Yenny works selling ice cream, food, and handicrafts. With her last loan, Yenny was able to increase her business capital and received other benefits, for example, giving better education and food to her children. Right now Yenny needs a loan to buy groceries and ice cream.

Yenny is thankful for the support that you will provide her and is committed to make the loan payments in a responsible manner.

loans.use: to buy basic merchandise

loans.name: Selene

texts.es: Selene continua  con el negocio de  crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas y con la compra y venta de leche. La socia esta mejorando poco a poco y con mucho esfuerzo en esta ocasion ella desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de gallinas 50 y de 200 cuyes.
texts.en: Selene continues with her businesses of raising small animals, such as guinea pigs and chickens, and buying and selling milk. She is improving little by little through a great deal of hard work. This time she wants to invest the loan in the purchase of 50 chickens and 200 guinea pigs.

loans.use: to puchase 50 chickens and 200 guinea pigs.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: Bertha continua prestando servicio de transporte, continua tambien con su otro negocio alterno de compra y venta de frutas, ella esta creciendo mucho y ahora desea invertir en la compra del doble de fruta que usualmente estaba comprando. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de frutas.
texts.en: Bertha has continued in the transportation service. She has also continued on with her other business which is fruit sales. She is growing a lot and now she wants to invest in purchasing double to amount of fruit she usually buys. She is requesting the loan to invest in purchasing fruit.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of fruit.

loans.name: Kheng

texts.en:
Kheng is 46 and married with three children. She lives with her husband in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. For the past seven years, she has been selling food and soft drinks and earns approximately 5 USD per day. Kheng's husband works growing maize and potato and he earns about 4 USD daily. All of Kheng's children are employed in a garment factory, earning about 12 USD each day.

Kheng is requesting a 1,000 USD loan to purchase farmland to grow crops and generate more income to support her family. In the future, she would like to rebuild her present house to make it much stronger and to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase farmland to grow crops

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Jocelyn has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 19 years. She requested a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Jocelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell

loans.name: Yeni

texts.es: Yeni continua con su negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. La socia a mejorado sus ventas y a incrementado su negocio motivo por el cual ella desea ampliar el espacio que designo para sus animalitos, ella comprar jaulas y tambien comprar cuyes 100 y pollitos 200.
texts.en: Yeni is still working raising small animals like guinea pigs and chickens. She has improved and increased her sales which motivated her to expand the space she allots her little critters. She will buy cages and will also buy 100 guinea pigs and 200 chicks.

loans.use: buy cages, 100 guinea pigs, and 200 chicks

loans.name: Qochasaywas Group

texts.es:
La socia perteneces al banco comunal QOCHASAYWAS; este banco está situado en el distrito de  Wanchaq en la provincia  de Cusco departamento de Cusco.

La socia María Elena tiene 42 años es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ceviches, la socia lleva años en este negocio siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia ,ella vende de forma ambulatoria en el paradero de un transporte público, a la vez la socia se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza como cremas,perfumes,colonias entre otros, la socia es una persona bien alegre y responsable con muchas ganas de salir adelante por su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de ceviche como cebolla, pescado, camote, limón entre otros.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de comida, restaurante, elaboración de tejidos como chompas, venta de productos de belleza y venta de prendas medicadas.

La socia agradece este medio por el cual le facilita el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank, Qochasaywas. This bank is located in the Wanchaq district which is in the both the province and department of Cusco. 

María Elena is 42 years old and is in a civil union. She has two children. She spends her days between her daily activities and her business selling ceviche [a "raw" fish dish]. She has had this business for years and as a result she has been able to get her family ahead. She makes her sales at the public bus station. She also makes a living selling beauty products like creams, perfumes, and colognes, among other things. She is a very happy and responsible person with a great desire to get ahead. 

She is requesting a loan to buy supplies to make ceviche like onion, fish, sweet potato, and limes, among other things.

The other members make a living in the businesses of food sales, a restaurant, weaving items like sweaters, selling beauty products and medical clothing. 

The member is grateful to this institution because it facilitates her loan. She is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making ceviche, like onion, fish, sweet potato, and lime, among others.

loans.name: Maya

texts.en:
Maya is 47 years old. She lives in the village of Sanavardo, East Georgia with her fourteen-year-old son George who goes to school. Maya farms, cleans houses and tends the gardens of neighbors, earning 250 GEL a month. According to Credo estimations, Maya and her son fall into the vulnerable poor category.

Maya has requested a loan of 1200 GEL from LLC to purchase calves and sow cabbage on a family-owned small farm plot. In the fall Maya will sell the grown calves and harvested maize at a profit. She will use this money to reinvest in her venture in order to expand it and make it more profitable. She will also purchase necessities for her son and so create better living conditions for them both.

loans.use: to purchase calves and cabbage seeds.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine lives in a small village in East Georgia.  She is 55 years old.  Marine is a widow and lives with her mother.  The family lives bellow the poverty line and receives relevant social assistance from the government.  The family's total average monthly income is 188 laris from the pensions of Marine and her mother.

In the past, Marine was busy with trade.  She used to purchase clothes in neighbor countries and sell them in the village.  Five years ago her mother got sick and Marine stopped her business to care for her.  Marine has applied for a loan to restart her business, trading imported clothes.  She will purchase clothes in neighbor countries for a low price and sell them in the village.  As a result, the family’s income will significantly increase and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Demur

texts.en:
Demur is 39 years old.  He is married and lives in a small village in the Kakheti Region with his wife Dali and eight-year-old son Tengiz, who attends school.  Demur is the sole income provider in the family.  He is employed as a worker in a local sawmill.  His salary is 400 laris per month.  According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the group of vulnerable poor.

Demur has requested a loan to cultivate family-owned land and to purchase watermelon seeds. He used to grow watermelon but, during past seven years, Demur was not able to run the family farming business because he did not have enough capital for investment.  With the borrowed amount, Demur will restart the business and earn income, which will allow the family to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to rent a tractor and purchase fertilizer and watermelon seeds.

loans.name: Kitessa

texts.en:
Kitessa lives in the village of Gulgula, in East Georgia.  He is 55 years old and lives with his wife, Assmat and 32-year-old daughter, Marine.  Kitessa is the sole income provider in the family.  He works as a taxi driver and provides transportation services to the local population.  The family’s total average monthly income is 300 laris.  They live in poverty. 

Kitessa has requested a loan to start-up an agricultural business.  He will purchase seven to eight calves and raise them for a period of five to six months.  In the fall, grown calves will be sold for a higher price and the family will gain additional income.  Kitessa plans to reinvest part of the income in the business.  He will use the remaining income to finance family needs and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Felicia Awooner

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Felicia. She is widowed and has two children, ages 14 and 4 years old. She has no additional dependents living with her. In 2002, Felicia established a textiles business. She began her business after she left a job as a dental nurse/chair side assistant in 1989. She had decided to study business management at university where she acquired a diploma. After this, she thought it fitting to establish her own business given her experience and qualifications. She has been in business since 2000. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,500,000 leones (SLL) every month from her business. She would like a loan of 5,000,000 SLL. Felicia requires a loan to buy 10 dozen ladies slippers at 360,000 SLL , 6 party dresses at 100,000 SLL and 12 blouses at 60,000 SLL. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 920,000 SLL. In the future, Felicia will feel grateful and thankful. She hopes to see her children through their education and is very proud of her business.

Hardworking and very grateful, Felicia thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy ladies slippers, party dresses and blouses.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice has operated her retail shop in Nakuru town for the last nine years. She is 35 years old and married with three children. She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a field officer and this will be her first loan. She plans to use this loan to buy more stock of sugar, maize flour and packets of sweets for sale. In the future, Eunice hopes to develop her retail shop into a wholesale.

loans.use: to add stock of sugar, maize flour and packets of sweets for sale.

loans.name: Banco Mujer En Progreso Group

texts.es:
Doña Ana es una señora de 53 años, es madre de 4 hijos, pero actualmente solo vive con su compañero, ella se dedica a la confección de ropa a la medida, otras prendas de vestir y para el hogar. Es una señora muy trabajadora, que busca la manera de aumentar los ingresos de su hogar ya que su compañero esta jubiliado y su pensión es muy baja. Sabe que los créditos de Fundación Mujer son de gra ayuda para poder invertir en materia prima, aumentando su producción y venta. El próposito de Doña Ana es crear un ahorro para ella y su compañero en el caso de una enfermedad ó padecimiento; ya que como ella misma lo dice ya no están tan jovenes. 
El grupo de Doña Ana; Banco Mujer En Progreso está compuesto por 10 socias, pero en està ocación solo ella y otras 2 integrantes van a solicitar un segundo préstamo y lo van a invertir en la compra de materia prima y mercadería.
texts.en:
Ana is 53 years old and the mother of 4 children, but right now she just lives with her partner. She makes a living making custom-made clothing, other garments and home items. She is a very hardworking woman who is looking for a way to increase her household earnings, since her partner is retired and his pension is very low. 

She knows that the Woman Foundation loans will greatly help her invest in raw materials, increasing her production and sales. Ana's goal is to create savings for herself and her partner in the case of sickness or suffering, since she herself admits they are not so young. 

Ana's group, Women in Progress Bank, is made up for 10 members, but right now only Ana and two other members are going to ask for a second loan, and they will put it towards the purchase of raw material and merchandise.

loans.use: in the purchase of kitchen products to sell.

loans.name: Hicham

texts.en:
Hicham is a 35-year-old single man, who used to live in France and came back to Lebanon in 2009 to open his own winery in his village. He is an ambitious man, who loves his country and works hard to be productive to benefit his environment as a whole.

Hicham loves his business a lot; that's why he applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, in order to buy a quality testing machine necessary for his production. This machine is very important in his business to make sure his product is of top quality. Hicham aims to start marketing his product all over the region, and he hopes for a big increase in his production and sales as soon as hoped for. He hopes to open a larger winery in the future to expand his production.

loans.use: to buy a quality testing machine necessary for his winery.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan has practiced farming in Ndunyu for the last seven years. She is 54 years old, married, and she and her husband have one child. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her fourth loan. She repaid her previous loan well. She plans to use the loan amount to purchase fertilizer, herbicides and seedlings.

In future, Susan hopes to become one of the leading farmers in her area.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, herbicides and seedlings.

loans.name: Fiorella Veronica

texts.es:
Fiorella  vive en Chincha, Perú. Chincha es nombrado por la  cultura de los Chinchas, célebre por sus avanzados conocimientos de la agricultura y sus proezas marítimas. Hoy en día Chincha es una increíble mezcla de culturas, con una gran población afro-peruana, debido a los restos de un pasado indígena, y las influencias del imperio español. La ciudad, junto a otras ciudades cerca de la costa del Pacífico, fue dañada en el año 2001 y 2007, fechas en las que ocurrieron terremotos de fuerte dimensión, pero ha soportado como siempre lo ha hecho durante gran parte de su historia. .  En su tiempo libre disfruta ver sus novelas;  como bien se sabe el Perú se caracteriza por tener las comidas más deliciosas del mundo y uno de los platos que a Fiorella le gusta mucho  es la “Carapulcra con sopa Seca”. Fiorella es madre de un pequeño de 5 años y va a la escuela inicial.
		
"Fiorella trabaja en venta de raspadilla, papa rellena y salchipollo , se dedica a este trabajo alrededor de 9 horas diarias, en un día Fiorella puede atender hasta 25 clientes, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque brinda buen trato a su cliente. 

Fiorella agradece mucho a los prestatarios ya que con su ayuda ella podra comprar utensilios para la preparación de sus platillos y una maquina eléctrica para raspadilla, con esta mejora podrá atender con mas rapidez a sus clientes y contara con las herramientas necesarias y asi seguir trabajando para cumplir su gran sueño: “Darle una profesión a su hijo y crecer como microempresaria."
texts.en:
Fiorella lives in Chincha, Peru.  Chincha is named for the Chincha culture, celebrated for its advanced knowledge of agriculture and its maritime prowess. Today Chincha is an incredible mix of cultures, with a large Afro-Peruvian culture, the remains of the indigenous past, and the influences of the Spanish empire. The city, along with other cities close to the Pacific coast, was damaged in 2001 and 2007, years of strong earthquakes, but it has endured as it always has during the better part of its history.

In her spare time she likes to watch her soap operas.  It is well known that Peru is known for having the most delicious food in the world, and one of the dishes Fiorella likes a lot is "carapulcra con sopa seca" [dried potatoes with meat and sauce served with pasta].  Fiorella is the mother of a five-year-old child who is in the first year of school.
		
Fiorella works selling snow cones, "papa rellena" [stuffed potatoes], and "salchipollo" [fried potatoes with chicken].  She works at this job about nine hours a day.  In one day she is able to serve up to 25 customers.  She believes that it is going well for her in her business because she treats her customers well.

Fiorella is very grateful to the lenders because with their help she will be able to buy utensils for preparing her dishes and an electric snow-cone machine.  With this improvement she will be able to serve her customers faster and have the necessary tools, and so continue working to realize her big dream: "To give her son a career and to grow as a micro-entrepreneur."

loans.use: to buy utensils and an electric snow-cone machine.

loans.name: Jackqueline

texts.en: Jackqueline   is 25 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is single and has two  children, 3 and 7 years old. The older one is attending  school and both of them live at home. For the past six years she has been selling rice  in the local market, and she is requesting a loan to purchase more  rice for her business. She plans to become  a big businesswoman in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more  rice for her business

loans.name: Maligie

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 40-year-old Maligie from Fullahtown, Central area, in Freetown, Sierra Leone. He is married with two children 12 years and 17 years old. Maligie's children attend school. 

Maligie runs a clothing store at P Z. He sells shirts, skirts, blouses and ladies' dresses. He has been running this business for five years. He works at the business 7 days per week and 8 hours a day. His other source of income comes from small-scale farming in the province. Maligie says that his business is doing well.

Maligie has requested a loan in order to buy more shirts, skirts, blouses and ladies' dresses. The extra income from this loan will allow him to change his family's living standard. In the future, he plans to be an investor in a clothing business. He thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase more  shirts, skirts, blouses and ladies' dresses.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 40 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and her husband is a contractor. They have three children aged 10 to 24 years old. All of them are attending school and live at home. For the past ten years, she has been selling pepper, bitter ball (melon), okra, oil, and salt on a table in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper, bitter ball, okra, oil, and salt for her business. She plans to expand her business and become an international businesswoman in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, bitter ball, okra, oil, and salt for her business

loans.name: Ellen Y.

texts.en: Ellen  is 40 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and her husband is a social worker. They have four children between the ages of 4 and 19; all of them are attending school and live at home. For the past ten years she has been selling used clothes  in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes  for her business. She plans to be a big businesswoman in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes  for her business

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en:
Hamida lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 6 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her mother). 

Hamida has a business of selling green bananas. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Hamida sells her products at the market, by means of retail. Hamida has requested a loan of 1500000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas. 

The main business challenge(s) for Hamida include seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start going to villages for green bananas and to buy a motor van for ease of transportation. Hamida lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel and his family are still farming. With joint effort they breed cattle and sell milk to dairy factory and the calves are sold to butcher’s shops.
With his first Kiva loan, Samvel bought fodder and now he also wants to buy a large amount of fodder for his cows and calves. So he is seeking for a $ 2,500 loan.

loans.use: to buy large lot of fodder for his cows and calves.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 7 children. 

Julie has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP11,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Julie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Julie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 6 children, all of whom are in school. She doesn’t have to take care of additional family members. Margaret has a business of selling used clothes. She has been in this business for 8 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Margaret sells her products at the market, by means of retail. Margret has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy bales of used clothes. She also generates additional income through selling piped water.

The main business challenge(s) for Margaret include seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start importing used clothes and to buy a motor van for ease in transportation. Margaret lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 54-year-old married man, father of nine children. He lives and works in Ain. Hassan has worked at raising livestock for twenty years. His business is going on fine, and he takes good care of his livestock.

Hassan is a hard worker, and he is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary food for his livestock at a special discount. Hassan is well-known in his region, with his good reputation and the special care he provides to his business.

Hassan hopes to expand his business to buy cows in the future, so his children can inherit a big herd of livestock.

loans.use: To buy necessary food for his livestock at special prices

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Eliza has a tailoring shop where she makes & sells office & school uniforms & gowns. She has had this business for 12 years. She requested a loan for 11,000 PHP to buy materials needed for the tailor shop.

Eliza has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Eliza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for the tailor shop

loans.name: Teresa Gaby

texts.es:
Teresa es una mujer muy emprendedora y entusiasta, ella vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima cálido en cualquier temporada del año, su agricultura y sobre todo por la generosidad de su gente, como buena peruana le gusta mucho la comida por ello uno de sus platos favorito 	es el riquísimo Arroz con pollo, ella estudio hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar para ser profesora. Teresa vive junto a su esposo y juntos tienen 2 hijos los cuales cursan estudios  superiores.

Teresa trabaja en su negocio de venta de comida, al cual le dedica alrededor de 5 horas diarias, se levanta muy temprano para tener todo limpio y aseado para poder ofrecer sus productos, en el día puede atender hasta 30 clientes, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque tiene buena sazón para la preparación de sus platillos y por ello sus clientes siempre regresan a su negocio.

Teresa está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda ella podrá comprar sillas mesas para mejorar su negocio, lo que le permitirá que sus clientes estén mas cómodos y se sientan a gusto, así ella seguirá trabajando para cumplir su gran sueño:” Tener un restaurante”.
texts.en:
Teresa is a very enterprising and enthusiastic woman. She lives in the city of Ica, a city which is characterized by its hot climate, in every season of the year, its agriculture and above all, the generosity of the people. As a good Peruvian woman, she likes food very much and therefore one of her favorite dishes is chicken and rice, which is very rich. She studied until her fifth year of secondary school, but she would have liked to go to school to become a professor. Teresa lives with her husband and their two children who go to university.

Teresa works in her business selling food, to which she dedicates 5 hours daily. She wakes up very early to have everything clean and tidy so she can sell her products. She serves up to thirty customers a day. She believes she is doing well with her business because she uses good seasonings in her dishes and this is why her customers always return to her business. 

Teresa is very grateful for Kiva's lenders because thanks to their help, she can buy chairs and tables to improve her business, as it will allow her customers to be more comfortable and at ease. This way she can continue working to fulfill her dream of having a restaurant.

loans.use: redesign her business by buying chairs and tables.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah  is 28 years old and lives in Buchanan, she is single and has three children, ages 11 to 15. All of her children are attending school and live at home. 

For the past ten years she has been selling fashion slippers in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fashion slippers for her business. She plans to buy a piece of land and build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more fashion slippers for her business.

loans.name: Charita

texts.en:
Charita is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Charita has a shop where she makes & sells snacks like rice cakes or "puto" & pancakes. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

Charita has been a member of HSPFI since 2007.  In the future, Charita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James has practiced farming in Olkalou  town for the last 12 years. He is 41 years old, married to Joyce, and they have two school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET  LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to purchase four bags of fertilizer with the whole amount.

In future, James hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Olkalou area.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Betty has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy stock of canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Betty has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Betty hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages for sale

loans.name: Yeabu

texts.en:
Meet 43-year-old Yeabu from Waterloo, in the eastern area in Freetown, Sierra Leone. She is married with four children between the ages of 15 years and 25 years. Three of her children are currently attending school.

 In 1997, Yeabu established her clothing business. She began her business because it is profitable and it cannot be affected by the rainy season. She works at the business 7 days per week, and 8 hours a day .She says that the main challenge to her business is the time moving from one neighboring country to another especially when the road is bad.

Yeabu requires a loan in order to buy more wax cotton, lace, clothes, shoes and creams. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her savings and also educate her children. In the future, Yeabu plans to build more stores. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more wax cotton, lace, clothes, shoes and creams.

loans.name: Roselle

texts.en:
Roselle is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with four children. 

Roselle has a retail shop where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 9,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Roselle has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Roselle hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Dende

texts.en:
Dende is a resident of Likoni, Kenya. She owns a tailoring shop which has been in operation for the last six years. She was formally a member of a ‘merry go round’, an informal saving scheme where people save and lend to each single person in turns. It is from here that she obtained the capital to start the business.

Dende is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to purchase material and dresses to sell. She expects to purchase more sewing machines in future despite the overall inflation.

loans.use: to purchase material and dresses for sale.

loans.name: Anacleta

texts.es:
La socia   Anacleta sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “IMASUMAC II” y continua viviendo en la ciudad del Cusco y donde también realiza sus actividades económicas.
 
La socia Anacleta sigue dedicándose a brindar servicio de transporte de turismo. Con el anterior préstamo Anacleta pudo hacer algunos arreglos de su movilidad y obtuvo buenos beneficios pudo comprar alimentos para sus hijos. En esta oportunidad Anacleta requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del carro.  

La socia Anacleta agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member, Anacleta, continues belonging to Imasumac II Communal Bank and living in the city of Cusco, where she also works.  She continues offering tourist transportation service.  With the previous loan Anacleta managed to make some repairs to her car and got good profits and was able to buy food for her children.

This time Anacleta needs the loan for car maintenance.  Anacleta is grateful for the support that will be given to her and also promises to make her payments on time in a disciplined fashion.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on her car.

loans.name: Aizel Glyn

texts.en:
Aizel Glyn  is 21 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Aizel Glyn  has a retail shop where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for 9,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Aizel Glyn  has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Aizel Glyn  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed and has 1 child. 

Analyn has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP8,000 to buy stock of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Analyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Analyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie is 50 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and her husband is a businessman. They have five children between the ages of 20 to 29, four of them are attending school and all of them live at home. 

For the past fifteen years she has been selling fish in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish for her business. She plans to help her husband and children.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is 27 years old, married and blessed with two children, aged nine and seven years respectively. He sells fish, a business he has been doing for the past seven years, and earns a monthly income of KES15,000. He is requesting a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase more fish to sell. 

Profit he earns from the loan will be ploughed back to his business. His dream is to become a successful business man. This is his first loan.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Idrissa

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 26-year-old Idrissa from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. He is married and has 2 children between the ages of 4 and 7 years. One of his children attends school. 

Idrissa runs a Phymacy; he sells blood tonic, malaria drugs, ampicilline, injections, and tablets. He has been running this business for 5 years. He works at the business from 7:00am until 10:00pm, 7 days per week, and has one employees working for him. His business is the only source of income he has. Idrissa says that the main challenge to his business is transportation and electricity problem.

Idrissa has requested a loan in order to buy more blood tonic, malaria drugs, ampicilline, injections, and tablets. The extra income from this loan will allow him to increase his profit and to educate his child. In the future, he plans to open a clinic. He thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more blood tonic, malaria drugs, ampicilline, injections, and tablets.

loans.name: Rietcel

texts.en:
Rietcel is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 
Rietcel has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy stock of canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Rietcel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rietcel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages for sale

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 7 children. 
Leonora is providing motorela or motorcycle services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy tools & pay for gasoline for the transport services.
Leonora has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Leonora hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for gasoline for the transport services

loans.name: Juney

texts.en:
Juney is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married. 

Juney has a shop that sells food supplements like vitamins & minerals. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of food supplements & natural ointments.

Juney has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Juney hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of food supplements & natural ointments

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has been in the fruits & vegetable sale business in Nakuru town for the last two years. She is 46 years old, married with three children. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a field officer during awareness and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of cabbage and kale for sale in her business.

In the future, Mary hopes to expand her business and supply vegetable to other parts of Nakuru.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cabbage and kale for sale in her business.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary  has operated her tailor shop in Nakuru town for the last 15 years.She is 39 years old and widowed with one child.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our existing clients and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more material for use in her tailor shop.

In future, Rosemary hopes to expand her business and open many branches and even offer tailoring training courses to youths in the Nakuru area, thereby increasing her income and improving her family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase clothing material for making dresses for sale

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Marina has a pigpen and she sells grown & matured pigs. She also buys & sells a variety of fish in the public market. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to animal feed for the pigs.

Marina has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Marina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for her pigs

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. 

Arlene has a retail shop where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Arlene has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Arlene hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Idrissa

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Idrissa from Waterloo, in the eastern area in Freetown, Sierra Leone. He is married with three children between the ages of 3 years and 9 years old. Two children are currently attending school. In 1994, Idrissa established his local foodstuffs business. He began his business because it has fast sales in the market and is attractive to business partners. He works at the business from 7:00 am until 7:30 pm, 7 days per week. He says that the main challenge to his business is a seasonal problem: during the dry season this type of products is very expensive.

Idrissa requires a loan in order to buy more bags of corn, beans and "gari" (cassava couscous). He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to improve his standard of living and educate his children. In the future, Idrissa plans to open more stores. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more bags of corn, beans and "gari" (cassava couscous).

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha   is 50 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and her husband is a social worker. They have four children between the ages of 16 and 30. Three  of them are attending school and live at home, while the oldest one is working and living on his own. For the past seven years she has been selling pumpkins, pawpaws, beans, and watermelons  in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more  pumpkins, pawpaws, beans, and watermelons  for her business. She plans to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more pumpkins, pawpaws, beans, and watermelons  for her business

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson has been in the butchery business in Nyahururu town for the last one year.  He is 58 years old, married to Lydia, and they have two school-going children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers during an awareness session and this will be his first loan.  He  plans to use the loan amount to buy more more sheep to add to his stock.

In future, Jackson hopes to expand his business and open another butchery soon.

loans.use: To buy 10 sheep to rear

loans.name: Johane

texts.en:
Johane is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. Johane is working in a private institution as a clerk.

Johane has a retail shop where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Johane has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Johane hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene has been in the fruit sales business in Nakuru town for the last three years.  She is 41 years old and single with seven children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers during an awareness campaign and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of mangoes to sell in her business.

In future, Irene hopes to expand her business and supply fruit to other parts of Nakuru.

loans.use: to buy more stock of mangoes to sell in her business.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child. 

Edward has a mechanic's shop that provides repair of vehicles & cars. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy tools needed for the mechanic's shop.

Edward has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Edward hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools needed for the mechanic's shop

loans.name: Adolat

texts.ru: Адолат проживает в городе Вахдат. Она замужем. Ей 46 лет. У нее пятеро детей. Она вместе с мужем занимается производством национальных видов тарелок (табаки чуби). Этим видом деятельности она занимается 25 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения древесины и деревянных досок.
texts.en: Adolat lives in the city of Vahdat. She is 46 years old, married, and has five children. She and her husband work in production of traditional dishware (tabaki chubi). She has been in this business for 25 years. She is requesting the loan for purchase of lumber and wood boards.

loans.use: To acquire lumber and wood boards.

loans.name: Savy

texts.en: Savy, 50, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for over two years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband is a security guard and earns about USD 3 per day. Due to small income, Savy would like to run an additional business to generate extra income for the family. With this goal in mind, Savy is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to run a public transportation service. In the future, she would like to expand her grocery store and rebuild her present house to make it bigger and stronger to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to run a public transportation service

loans.name: Ara

texts.en:
Ara is 38 years old. He lives in Ijevan with his family, which consists of his wife and three school aged children: two daughters and a son. His wife is a nurse and she works at Ijevan polyclinic. 
Ara graduated from the Agricultural Academy and has engaged in trading for more than 18 years. In his shop, Ara sells food and household goods. He also has storage where he keeps flour and fodder for wholesale. Ara buys the major part of merchandise from suppliers but once or twice a month, Ara rents a car and goes to Yerevan to buy goods. 
Ara is asking for a $ 3,000 loan to buy various household goods and wholesale flour and fodder for resale

loans.use: to buy various household goods and wholesale flour and fodder for resale

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en: Jamal is a 53-year-old Lebanese woman. She’s married and lives with her husband and two working children. During her whole life, she was the one taking care of her family and she still does. She has been working in cleaning product sales on a freelance basis. She provides her customers with a good service in order to build an excellent relationship with them. Today, she’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional cleaning products for her business. She notes that this will improve her work therefore her returns. In the future, she plans to take out more Kiva loans, develop her business, and open her own cleaning products shop.

loans.use: to purchase additional cleaning products for her business

loans.name: Nematchon

texts.ru: Нематчон мужчина 50 лет, отец пятерых детей. Жена пенсионерка, домохозяйка. Сам работает трактористом в колхозе, его заработная плата очень минимальная, поэтому он занимается откормом и продажей крупно рогатого скота. Сейчас у него три коровы, которые днём пасутся на пастбище. Из-за спада цен на скот, Нематчон решил в кредит купить ещё одну молодую корову.
texts.en: Nematchon is a 50 year old man and the father of five children. His wife is retired and a housewife. He himself is a tractor driver on a collective farm, but his salary is very small, so he also raises and sells cattle. Right now he has three cows which graze on pasture during the day. Because of the drop in price of livestock Nematchon decided to use a loan to buy another young cow.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 45 years old, married to Philip, and blessed with two children aged 18 and 12 years respectively. She is in the matatu (minibus) business which she ventured into seven years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 70,000.

She has requested a loan of KES.50,000 to purchase spare parts for his vehicle. The profit she makes would buy her another vehicle. She hopes to live a better life. This is her third loan.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for her vehicle.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is separated with one child.
 
James has a hardware shop that sells motorcycle and vehicle parts. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy stock of motorcycle and vehicle parts.

James has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, James hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy stock of motorcycle and vehicle parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 7 children. 
Marilou is making & peddling snacks like ice candy bars & cookies. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks.
Marilou has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Marilou hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks

loans.name: Sarvinoz

texts.ru: Сарвиноз жительница города Вахдат. Ей 33 года. Она разведена. У нее один ребенок. Сарвиноз живет вместе с родителями. Она занимается посевом сельскохозяйственных культур. В этой области она пять лет. Кредит берет для посева пшеницы.
texts.en: Sarvinoz is a resident of the city of Vakhdat. She is 33 years old. She is divorced and has one child. Sarvinoz lives with her parents. She grows field crops, a business she has been in for five years. She is requesting a loan in order to plant wheat.

loans.use: plant wheat

loans.name: Jartu

texts.en: Jartu is 23 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is single and has two children aged 6 and 8, both attending school and living at home. For the past 4 years, she has been selling rubber dishes and used clothes in the local market. She started this business with the help of her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rubber dishes and used clothes for her business. She plans to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes and rubber dishes for her business

loans.name: Idrissa    K

texts.en:
This is 48-year-old Idrissa from Tengbeh town Western area in Freetown, Sierra Leone. He is married with 2 children aged 4 and 12 years.

Idrissa runs a Pharmacy at Wilberforce village. He sells paracetamol tabs, malarial drugs, baby food, procaine injections (Novocain: type of anesthesia) and blood tonic. He has been running this business for 15 years. He began his business because he needed a permanent source of income to take care of his family. He works in the business 7 days per week and 18 hours a day. He also earns income from the patients he treats. He says that the main challenge for his business is that most of his customer do not have money for their medical bills.

Idrissa has requested a loan in order to buy more paracetamol tabs, malarial drugs, baby food, procaine injections, and blood tonic. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve his standard of living and educate his children. In the future, he plans to open a clinic. He appreciates your support.

loans.use: To buy more paracetamol tabs, malarial drugs, baby food, and procaine injections

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard has operated in the transport industry in Nakuru town for the last thee years. He is 34 years old and married to Chebet; they have two children. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend, and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to diversify his business to start selling eggs. This will help him acquire more money to purchase another motorcycle.

In the future, Leonard hopes to buy a pickup truck, which he will be using to transport eggs around the town.

loans.use: to diversify his business to start selling eggs.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 19 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single.
