Juana still belongs to the “IMASUMAC II” communal bank and she still lives in the city of Cuzco where she also does her economic activities. 

Juana still sells firewood and now she sells fodder and kindling. With the previous loan, Juana was able to grow her business and obtain good benefits, such as a better quality of life for her children, like feeding them well. At this time, Juana needs the loan to buy firewood and fodder. 

Juana is thankful for the support she has been given and she is committed to making her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of wood for firewood.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La socia   Sonia sigue pertenece al banco comunal “IMASUMAC II” y continua viviendo en la ciudad del Cusco y donde también realiza sus actividades económicas. 

La socia Sonia sigue dedicándose a la venta de ropa de bebes. Con el anterior préstamo Sonia pudo incrementar  su negocio y obtuvo buenos beneficios como por ejemplo dar mejor calidad de vida a su hijo ósea darles una buena alimentación. En esta oportunidad Sonia requiere el préstamo para comprar ropa de bebes. 

La socia Sonia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Sonia still belongs to the “IMASUMAC II” communal bank and she still lives in the city of Cuzco, where she also does her economic activities. 

Sonia still works selling baby clothes. With the previous loan, Sonia was able to grow her business and obtain good benefits, for example giving her son a better quality of life by feeding him well. At this time, Sonia needs the loan to buy baby clothing.  

Sonia is thankful for the support that she has received and she is committed to making her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: To buy baby clothes.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose used the previous loan to buy blankets, carpets and bed covers to sell. In her business she faces a problem of inadequate capital to purchase stock since the demand is very high. Her dream is to build a permanent home and expand her business into new markets. Rose needs this loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is forty-eight years old from Nakuru and is married to Isaac; they have three children who are in school.

Caroline has a clothing business which she has been doing for the past three years. She wants a loan to enable her to buy vests and dresses to add to her stock for sale. She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a fellow client.

She hopes to open a boutique in the future.

loans.use: To buy more vests and dresses.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is fifty-two years old and married to Beatrice. Together they have two children. He sells nursery bed trees and has been in the business for the past eight years.

This is his first loan from KADET Ltd. He will use the loan amount to purchase seedlings for his nursery. He hopes to open another nursery in a different place.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings.

loans.name: Desman

texts.en:
Desman is a farmer who has been in the agriculture sector for over five years. He got capital by working for a tea company where he managed to save money to start his own farming activities.

In his business, he faces hardships of price fluctuations, customers not paying on time and seasonal weather. His dream is to educate his children, buy a car, get some education himself, and buy land to grow crops.

Desman used the previous loan to clear land to plant cow peas and now needs a new loan to buy more cow peas to plant.

loans.use: to buy cow peas to plant.

loans.name: Chandia

texts.en:
Chandia is a thirty-eight-year-old business woman, who lives in Juba Nimule. She is married with four children between the ages of eighteen and twelve. All four of them go to school. 

Chandia runs a food store business, and she has been in the business for six years. She has no employees. Chandia heard about Finance Sudan through fellow clients as well from the radio. She is taking a loan of 700 SDG to purchase more items like beans, rice, simsim (sesame) and many others. In addition to this business Chandia has an additional source of income from her motorcycle which is used as a boda boda (motorcycle taxi).

In five years time, Chandia would like to hope for a big food store in the same market, and also to buy one more motorcycle. Her major challenges include home expenses, particularly now as everything is very expensive in Juba.

Chandia says that she is giving a lot of appreciation to Finance South Sudan.

loans.use: to purchase more items like beans, rice and simsim.

loans.name: Kasifa

texts.en:
Kasifa lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her mother). Kasifa has a business selling bananas. She has been in this business for a year, and she works six days a week. Kasifa sells her products at the market, by means of retail. 

Kasifa has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas. The main business challenges for Kasifa include seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start going to villages for bananas and to buy a motor van to ease transportation.

Kasifa lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water.Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and paying utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is 31 years old, married and blessed with three children ages 11, nine and seven.  She sells scrap metal for a business she started two years ago. She earns a monthly income of KES 16,000.

She has requested for a loan of KES 30,000 to buy scrap metal for re-sale. Her profit will help her buy a plot of land. She hopes to have a better future with her family.  This is her first loan.

loans.use: To buy scrap metal for re-sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more eggs to add to her stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy security uniforms.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose has been in welding in Nakuru town for the last three years.  He is 44 years old, married to Jane and they have two school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy more clothes for sale so that she  can  meet the demands of her customers.

In future, Rose hopes to open a boutique in future.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Johnstone

texts.en:
Johnstone is 27 years old and married to Gladys, who also contributes to the family income. They have a one-year-old child. He has been running a barber shop for about two years and earns a monthly income of about 10,000 KES.

This is Johnstone's first loan of KES. 20,000 with KADET LTD, and he will use the loan to renovate his barbershop. He hopes to invest his profits in the real estate business.

loans.use: to renovate his barber shop.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a fifty-seven-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and one working child. He’s working to satisfy his family's needs and to be capable of covering their living expenses. He has been involved in the tailoring field for more than twenty years until he decided to open his own shop. He loves his work and always looks for new, different and original designs. 

Today, he’s in need of a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional tailoring supplies such as textiles in addition to a tailoring machine. He notes that this will increase his sales by 20%. In the future, he plans to open his own clothing shop.

loans.use: to purchase additional tailoring supplies such as textiles in addition to a tailoring machine.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en:
Emmy is a thirty-two-year old married man with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has done farming for over eleven years. He started this business with capital which he raised from a barber salon, and then he grew onions, bought a plot and went into commercial farming. He faces hardships of price fluctuations, customers not paying on time and seasonal weather. His dream is to educate his children, buy a car, build a permanent home and diversify his businesses into new markets.

Emmy needs this loan to hire laborers to till his land.

loans.use: to hire labourers to till his land.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a thirty-seven-year-old married man living in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer who has worked for over ten years. He raised capital through personal savings and managed to start his own business. He faces a hardship of price fluctuation. His dream is to buy and own large tea plantations and diversifying his business to include other crops. 

Alex needs this loan to buy a tea plantation.

loans.use: to buy a tea plantation.

loans.name: Agnes  Nyambura

texts.en:
Agnes's business is doing well, with an income of about 6,000 Kenya shillings a month. Agnes sells second hand clothes as a primary business and also makes peanuts butter as a secondary business.

She is requesting a loan of KES 40,000 from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous one. She wants to use the loan amount to buy more clothes and peanuts for making butter for sale. She hopes to use the anticipated profits to buy a grinding machine for making peanut butter.

loans.use: to buy more second hand clothes and bed sheets for sale, and buy bigger containers for packing peanut butter.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Luchadoras se formo con la unión de doce mujeres de la ciudad de Caacupé, son mujeres jefas de familia que desean ayudar a sus hijos a tener un futuro mejor del que ellas tuvieron, y es por ello que se esfuerzan al máximo día a día. Su objetivo es crecer todas ellas, no solo en lo económico, sino también en lo personal.
Carmen se dedica a la venta de chipa, y comenta que le va muy bien, pues es muy solicitada. Ella las vende de forma ambulante y cuenta que es un trabajo muy sacrificado, pero que pese a ello le gusta mucho lo que hace, pues es un trabajo digno y decoroso.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de chipa, con lo que podrá seguir trabajando y creciendo como microempresaria. Está muy contenta por el apoyo recibido de parte de fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
"Mujeres Luchadoras" (fighting women) is a group made up of twelve women from the city of Caacupé. These women are heads of family and want to help their children to have a better future than they had themselves, and this is why they are giving their best day after day. Their shared objective is growth, not only economic but also personal.
Carmen sells chipas (sort of cheese buns) and says that she is doing very well, because her chipas are in high demand. She sells them hawking in the streets, a very tiring job, but nevertheless she loves what she is doing because it is a decent and respectable activity. She applies for this loan to buy chipas, which will enable her to continue to work and grow in her small business. She is very happy for the support received by the microfinance institution Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy chipas for resale.

loans.name: Priscillah

texts.en:
Priscillah has been in farming activity in Olkalou town. She is 44 years old and married with three children. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her third loan. She paid all her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizers for farming.

In future, Priscillah hopes to expand her farm and yield more produce.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for farming.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has 2 children, both of whom are in school. She doesn't take care of additional family members. She has a business of a restaurant. She has been in this business for 5 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. 

She rus her restaurant at the market and sells food on retail bais. She has requested  for a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, chicken, rice, and both Irish and sweet potatoes. She also generates additional income through rental houses.

The main business challenges for Margaret include seasonality and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked restaurant and to build more rental houses. She lives in a home that she owns where she has access to electricity and to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, beef, chicken, rice, and both Irish and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 40 years old, married to Pius, and blessed with three children aged 18, 10 and seven years old. She sells nets, a business she started 10 years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 30,000. She has requested a loan worth KES 30,000 to purchase a bale of net curtains for sale. 

Profit from her business will help her purchase additional stock and pay fees for her children. Her dream is to buy a plot of land and build rental houses. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To buy one bale of net curtains for sale

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan lives in Yei. She is a charcoal seller and has been in business for five years. She is 30 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom are still in school. 

Susan heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Monika

texts.en:
Monika lives in Yei, South Sudan.  She is a sells food, and has been in business for six years.  She is 50 years old, married, and has six children; two of them are in school. 

Monika heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her first loan from BRAC.  She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase sugar.  She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase sugar for resale.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora lives in Buluk. She sells charcoal and has been in business for five years. She is 34 years old, married, and has four children; all of them are still in school. 

Flora heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Jania

texts.en:
Jania lives in Yei she sells food stuffs, and has been in business for four years. She is 30 years old, married, and has four children, three of them are still in school. 

Jania heard about BRAC South Sudan from credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 700 in order to purchase sugar, oil. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, oil for sale.

loans.name: Las Tejedoras De Ñanduti 2 Group

texts.es:
Las Sras del comité Las tejedoras de ñanduti II, son personas muy trabajadoras, ellas están muy agradecidas con la fundación porque gracias a las facilidades de los créditos ellas pueden acceder a él y de ese modo invertir en sus negocios y otras iniciar una actividad comercial.
La presidenta, la señora Blanca vive con su marido e hijos, ella se dedica a la artesanía en ñanduti (Tejido típico paraguayo). Ella junto con sus compañeras realiza constantes actividades y de ese modo fomentar la integración entre las compañeras y tratar de adelantar sus cuotas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de hilos y agujas, con las cuales podrá seguir haciendo su tejido en ñanduti, para que de esa forma pueda seguir ayudando con la economía de su familia.
texts.en: The women of "Las tejedoras de ñandutí 2" Group (the ñandutí knitters) are hard-working people and very grateful to the microfinance institution Fundación Paraguaya for their loan facility, because it enables them to have access to credit and invest in their business or launch a new commercial activity. The president of the group is Señora Blanca, who lives with her husband and children and knits ñandutí, a traditional embroidered lace of Paraguay. She and her fellow group members are constantly working to promote the integration of the group members and try to collect in advance the money to pay off their loan. Blanca applies for this loan to buy thread and needles, which she needs to continue knitting ñandutí laces in order to financially support her family.

loans.use: to buy thread and needles for her knitting activity.

loans.name: Cristo Nos Ama Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal está conformado por 10 emprendedores que ya han venido trabajando con Fundación León 2000, cada uno de los emprendedores se apoyan y se brindan consejos en sus negocios para salir adelante. En el crédito anterior que se les otorgo a este grupo lo invirtieron en cada uno de sus negocios para aumentar su inventario, los emprendedores nos expresan que también han aumento sus clientes a quienes les ofrecen su producto. Silvia Melania es una emprendedora que es parte de este grupo y su negocio es la venta de tortilla y además vente frijoles cosidos, ella actualmente esta solicitando financiamiento para la compra de frijoles, maíz, cal, leña, bolsas, entre otros productos que requiere para el negocio.
texts.en:
This community bank is made up of ten entrepreneurs who are existing clients of Fundación León 2000.  All of these entrepreneurs support each other and share tips from their businesses so that they can each make progress.  The group used their previous loan to invest in their businesses in order to increase their stock.  They tell us that they also increased the number of customers to whom they sell their products.  

Silvia Melania is an entrepreneur who belongs to this group and her business is selling tortillas.  She also sells cooked beans.  She is currently requesting a loan to buy beans, corn, lime, firewood, bags and other products that she needs for her business.

loans.use: to buy beans, corn, lime, firewood, bags and other products that she needs for her business

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 42-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and four school-aged children. He is the one responsible for covering their heavy expenses and paying their study fees. Hussein decided to take on his own his family responsibilities and start his own business. For this reason, he opened his own butchery and bakery in 2006. 

Today, Hussein is seeking a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a generator for his business. With a generator, he will be able to facilitate his business and augment his sales. In the future, he plans to raise cattle and start his own dairy products trading business.

loans.use: to purchase a generator for his butchery and bakery business.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 48 years old and from Ndunyu Njeru.  She is married to Peter and they have two children who are in school.

Lucy has a hotel business, which she has been running for the past year, and she has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her buy flour, oil, sugar, salt, and tea leaves.

She hopes to expand her business and own a bigger hotel.

loans.use: To buy flour, oil, sugar, salt, and tea leaves.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is 38 years old, from Nakuru, and is married to David. They have four children who are between the ages of 4 and 16 years old.

Teresia has a retail business that she has been running for the past seven years.  She has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her buy sodas and fruits.

She hopes to be able to have a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy sodas and fruits.

loans.name: Greivin

texts.es: Greivin, tiene la edad  de 32 años, está en unión libre,  vive con sus 3 hijos y su esposa que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito va comprar una picadora de pasto y realizar la instalación de un tanque de enfriamiento. El cuenta con una pequeña lechería desde varios años atrás y le esta haciendo mejoras pues está en constante crecimiento. El lo que tiene pensado es darles a sus animales un mejor cuidado en cuanto a la alimentación y con la leche que producirá la almacenara en el tanque que instalara. El tiene pensado generar más ganancias con estas mejoras a su lechería y así llegar a vender más cantidad de leche al final de la semana. El quiere mejorar su estabilidad económica cada día y tener un mejor futuro con su familia. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Greivin is 32 years old.  He lives with his common-law wife and his three children who are his main priority.  He will use his loan to buy a fodder shredder and install a cooling tank.  He has owned a small dairy for some years and he is making improvements to it as his business is constantly growing.  He plans to provide his animals with the best care possible as regards their feed and he will store the milk that they produce in the tank which he is about to install.  He plans to make more profits as a result of these improvements to his dairy and thereby manage to sell a larger quantity of milk at the end of the week.  He would like to improve his financial stability and enjoy a better future together with his family.

This is the first loan that Greivin has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not received any previous loans from State banks but FUDECOSUR gave him this loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to make some improvements to his dairy

loans.name: Ovidio

texts.es: Ovidio, tiene la edad de 45 años, está casado,  vive con su hijo y su esposa que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito pretende comprar los insumos como las fertilizantes y agroquímicos para tener su siembra en óptimas condiciones. El tiene un terreno en muy buenas condiciones para la explotación de este cultivo, por lo cual volvió a realizar la siembra el cultivo este año. El tienen pensado generar el máximo de las ganancias y producir una muy buena cosecha para obtener de las ventas una buena cantidad de dinero. El tiene pensado con este dinero salir adelante con el crédito y mejorar su estabilidad económica del futuro.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Ovidio is 45 years old, married, and lives with his son and wife who are his main priority.  He plans to use his loan to buy supplies such as fertilizers and agricultural chemicals to keep his crops in top condition.  He has a plot of land which is in very good condition for growing his crops and so he re-sowed them there this year.  He plans to make as much profit as possible and produce a very good harvest so that he can make a good sum of money from his sales.  He plans to use this money to repay his loan and improve his future financial stability.

This is the first loan that Ovidio has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not received previous loans from State banks but FUDECOSUR gave him this loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to maintain his bean crop

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (sisters).  She has a business of selling bananas.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 6 days out of every week.  She sells her products at the market, by means of retail.     

Rehema has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy bunches of bananas.     The main business challenge(s) for Rehema include seasonality and thieves.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start going to villages for bananas to buy and become a wholesaler.    

She lives in a home that she rents where she has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a 27-year-old married man with three children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a motorcyclist and has been in that business for 2 years. He hires a motorcycle and pays back 60% of his earnings to the motorcycle owner. In that business his challenges are high fuel and transportation costs and the rainy season, which limits his movements. His dream is buying a motorcycle and educating his children. Charles needs the loan to buy his own motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy his own motorcycle.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a 22-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He owns a retail shop that he started 1 year ago. He started by selling bananas and raised capital to start his shop. He faces a challenge of customers not paying on time. His dream is buying a motorcycle to diversify business and owning a wholesale shop. Moses needs the loan to buy a motorcycle for a transport business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for a transport business.

loans.name: Claveles Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CLEVELES” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Juan Pablo II, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Simona. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Elaboración de macramé, venta de salchipapas, venta de productos D x N, venta de dulces, elaboración de mantas.

La señora Simona,  indica que es el primer año que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de unas vecinas. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de mantas que viene trabajando hace algún tiempo, aprendiendo el mismo de un club de madres.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las ferias y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de credito.
texts.en:
The Cleveles communal bank will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Juan Pablo II regional office.  It is comprised of six members and is run by a board of directors, which Simona heads.  The businesses that the ladies are engaged in are varied and include: making macramé, selling “salchipapas” (fried potatoes and fried sausages), selling DX N products (natural health care supplements), selling sweets, and making blankets.

Simona says that this is her first year of working with Pro Mujer.  She joined the institution by invitation from some neighbors.  She currently has a business weaving blankets, which she has been doing for some time.  She learned how to this at a club for mothers.

The loan that she will now take is to buy wool, which she will get at the fairs.  She will use the wool to make products that she will  later sell by order.  This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family.  She is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she replied that she likes the loans.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 32-year-old married man, living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has been selling used clothes for the past 8 years. His challenges are price fluctuations, inflation and seasonal customers. His dream is educating his children and diversifying his business. Patrick needs the loan to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Precious

texts.en:
Precious is 34 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and her husband is a social worker. They have four children between the ages of 7 and 10, and all of them are attending school and live at home. For the past ten years she has been selling cosmetics in the local market. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more cosmetics for her business. She plans to be a big businesswoman in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Kamleh

texts.en:
Kamleh is a 32-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and three children, who are all studying. She cooperates with her husband to cover the family expenses. Her husband works on his own. As for Kamleh, she has been working from her home as a private teacher for the past seven years. She’s intelligent and an expert in her field. 

Today, she’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to prepare a teaching room for her business. She notes that this will allow her to develop her way of teaching, thus her communication with her students. In the future, she plans to open her own learning center.

loans.use: to prepare a teaching room for her business.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 3 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her late brother's children).  Lucy has a business of selling spare parts.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. She sells her products in a shop, by means of retail.  

She has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more spare parts. The main business challenges for Lucy include seasonality and thieves.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start going to Japan and Dubai for spare parts and to build her own house. Lucy lives in a home that she rents where she has access to electricity and to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is a 26-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents and is the only working sibling.  With the support of his father, who is their main income provider, Abbas became capable of fulfilling his family's demands.  

Abbas has owned an aluminum shop since 2010. Today, he is looking for a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase added aluminum supplies for his business. He notes that this will return higher income for him. In the future, he plans to open other branches in the surrounding areas.

loans.use: buy aluminum supplies

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 26-year-old man. He’s single and lives in Lebanon with his parents. His father is the one taking care of his family. As for Hussein, he has been working in a local hotel since 2010. He’s an expert in his field and is looking to further develop his skills. 

Today, he needs to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to pay his university fees. This Kiva loan will allow him to continue his education and achieve higher positions. In the future, he plans to focus on a good job to better support his family.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 25-year-old Lebanese engaged woman living with her parents and two siblings. She has big responsibilities to be able to cover her educational fees. She has been working as a sales woman in one of the local companies since 2010. 

Today, Nancy wants to request a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to pay her university fees until graduation. She will be more than happy to graduate and achieve good positions. In the future, she plans to take more Kiva loans to continue covering her educational fees.

loans.use: to pay her university fees until graduation.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 25-year-old single Lebanese man. He lives with his parents and only one working sibling. His father is trying his best to cover their family expenses. As for Ahmad, he has been working in mobile phone repair for the past nine years. Today, he’s asking to borrow a youth loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l. to renovate his shop and purchase additional spare parts. In that way, he will be able to carry on his work in a good way and therefore respond to his clients' demands. In the future, he plans to open his own mobile phone shop.

loans.use: to renovate his shop and purchase additional spare parts.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Samer

texts.en: Samer is a 27-year-old man. He’s single and lives with his parents and two siblings, one of whom is working while the other is still studying. He cooperates with his father and brother to provide a better future for their family. He has been working at selling tools and tackles used in construction and maintenance work. Today, he wants to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase supplementary tools and tackles for his shop. He notes that this Kiva loan will increase his profits by 20%. In the future, he plans to enlarge his shop and diversify his items.

loans.use: to purchase supplementary tools and tackles for his shop.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 30-year-old married Lebanese man. He lives with his wife and their one school-aged child. He is the one taking care of the family and responding to their needs. Unlike others his age, Mohammad started to work very early, expecting to build a good and solid career. He has been working as a plumber since 2006 on a freelance basis and already has thirteen years of experience in this area. Today, he needs to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new plumbing tools and equipment for his business. He notes that he’s willing to take bigger projects and this Kiva loan will help him achieve his goal. In the future, he plans to expand his work and attract new clients.

loans.use: to purchase new plumbing tools and equipment for his business.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en: Rashid is a 54-year-old married Lebanese man. He lives with his wife and three school-aged children. After many years of experience as a carpenter, Rashid decided to open his own carpentry business in 1990. He strives to work really hard in order to satisfy his family's needs and cover his children's school fees. He’s a reputable man who has gained a fair number of loyal customers so far. Today, he is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase the needed quantity of wood for his work. He notes that this will improve his business and thus boost his productivity by 30%. In the future, he plans to take bigger projects outside the country.

loans.use: to purchase the needed quantity of wood for his work.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nabil

texts.en:
Nabil is a 23-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents and two siblings. His father is putting all his effort into being able to respond to his family's requests.  In 2010, Nabil decided to start his own business as a constructor, after five years of experience in this domain. 

Today, he’s requesting to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase added construction materials for his business. This loan will facilitate his business operations and enable him to take new projects. In the future, he plans to improve his business and work hard in order to serve his customers as quickly as he can.

loans.use: to purchase added construction materials for his business.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 22-year-old single man. He lives with his parents and three siblings, two of whom are working. His siblings are the main income providers in the family and the only support. For this reason, Mahmoud decided to have his own business, hoping to add some special changes in their life and help them. 

He opened his own barber shop in 2007. Today, he’s asking to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new barbering tools. In that way, he will be able to gain added clients and improve his business.  In the future, he plans to enlarge his salon and hire people to work with him.

loans.use: to purchase new barbering tools.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a twenty-five-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents and three siblings. Even though he’s working, still his father is considered the main income provider in the family. For this reason, he decided to have his own free-lance job in order to help his father with the family expenses. He works providing providing legal documentation services and has many customers visiting him to smooth the preparation of their official documents. 

Today, he’s looking for a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy a minivan for his business. This Kiva loan will facilitate his transportation. In the future, he plans to open his own office.

loans.use: to buy a minivan for his business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Rana is a 46-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and three children. Her husband who works as a truck mechanic is their main income provider and is looking to fulfill their needs. Rana started her own home business as a private teacher thirteen years ago and is looking to further improve her work. She also has a parallel job at a local school. 

Today, she needs to take out a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase bookshelves for her business. In that way she will be able to organize her documents in a proper way and therefore enhance her way of teaching. In the future, she plans to open her own learning center.

loans.use: to purchase bookshelves for her business

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is a 23-year-old married Lebanese woman living with her husband, taking care of the family, and wanting to have children. She started to work from her home as a hairdresser and beautician three years ago. She has her loyal customers who believe in her fashionable and chic designs. Today, she’s in need of a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy new cosmetic products such as nail polish, cotton, polish remover, and many hairdressing tools. This will develop her business by 30%. In the future, she plans to take more Kiva loans and open her own beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy new cosmetic products such as nail polish, cotton, polish remover, and many hairdressing tools

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 20-year-old Lebanese single man who lives with his parents and three siblings two of whom are working. He was helping his father with covering their expenses.  Mohammad opened his own bakery in 2009. He’s well known for his delicious food. Today, he wants to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added raw materials for his bakery such as salt, flour and many other items. He notes that this will improve his work which allow him attract more clients. In the future, Mohammad plans to renovate and expand his bakery.

loans.use: to purchase added raw materials for his bakery such as salt, flour and many other items

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en: Abbas is a single 23-year-old Lebanese man. He lives with his parents and two working siblings. His father is the one supporting his family and fulfilling their needs. Abbas works independently on a free-lance basis. He has been working in floor cleaning for the past five years. Today, he’s looking for a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a new generator. He notes that the more projects he takes on, the higher his revenues will be.  In the future, he plans to take more Kiva loans and further develop his business.

loans.use: to purchase a new generator.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mirna

texts.en: Mirna is a 30 year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and two school-aged children. She cooperates with her husband in order to satisfy their needs and in order to be capable of living as they should be. In order to help him, she decided to start her own home business. She has been working as a clothes and makeup trader since 2009. She sells stylish, fashionable and trendy clothes. Today, she’s requesting to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a new collection of clothes such as dresses, scarves and pants in addition to makeup sets. She notes that this loan will certainly push her to get higher returns. In the future, she plans to open her own beauty salon very soon.

loans.use: to purchase a new collection of clothes such as dresses, scarves and pants in addition to makeup sets.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en: Leila is a 30-year-old Lebanese woman. She is married and living with her husband and two school-aged children. Her husband is the one responsible for them and the whole family is really thankful for what he did so far and will be going to do. Leila decided to start her own work as a photographer in 2009 and has opened her own studio. She is talented and works with a high professionalism. Today, she is asking for a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a new scanner machine for her work in order to increase her sales and thus her revenues. In the future, she plans to open her own photography center.

loans.use: to purchase a new scanner machine for her work.

loans.name: Khoder

texts.en:
Khoder is a 28-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents and six working siblings. His siblings are the main income providers in the family, though Khoder is always ready to help whenever they need it. He started to work as a painter in 2008, and has built a good reputation with a fair number of customers asking for his services. He also works in home decoration.  

Today, he seeks to borrow a youth loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new painting tools in order to keep being up-to-date and enhance his business. In that way, he will be capable of attracting added customers, and therefore earn higher revenues. In the future, he plans to open his own painting shop.

loans.use: to purchase new painting tools.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 36-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two children, both of whom are studying. He’s doing the best he can to offer a respectable life for his family and pay his children's study fees. He has been working in the decorating business since 2008. He’s specialized in installing gypsum boards (also known as dry wall) and creating new decoration designs. Today, he’s in need of a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional gypsum boards and decoration supplies in order to further develop his business, and thus increase his profits. In the future, he seeks to open his own gallery.

loans.use: to purchase added gypsum boards and room furniture.

loans.name: Youness

texts.en: Youness is a 28-year-old single Lebanese man. He lives with his parents and three working siblings. He strives to work really hard with the cooperation of his family in order to enrich their way of life and cover the heavy costs of living. Youness began his own work as a furniture painter in 2011. He has gained different clients from different areas especially because of his good and well organized work. Today, he’s requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new painting tools and brushes for his business in order to gain more customers and thus increase his income. In the future, he plans to open his own furniture gallery.

loans.use: to purchase new painting tools and brushes for his business.

loans.name: Narimane

texts.en:
Narimane is a 29-year-old Lebanese single woman living with her parents. She strives to work really hard to help her family with the expenses. She has been working as a beautician from her home since 2006. She’s a reputable person and ladies visit her from all over the neighboring villages. 

Today, she wants to take out a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new cosmetics and beauty supplies. This loan will increase her sales therefore her profits thus her revenues. In the future, she plans to open her own beauty salon.

loans.use: to purchase new cosmetics and beauty supplies

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is a 30-year old Lebanese married man living on his own. He strives to work really hard in order to improve his way of living. Hasan has been working as a truck mechanic for eight years and has his own garage. He’s well known for his good work and has a good reputation. He also visits his customers wherever they are if needed. Today, he has the intention to borrow a youth loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase the necessary mechanical supplies for his garage in order to carry on his work in a proper way and nonstop without facing problems. In the future, he plans to take more Kiva loans and improve his garage.

loans.use: to purchase the necessary mechanical supplies for his garage

loans.name: Georges

texts.en:
Georges is a 28-year-old Lebanese single man living with two relatives. Regardless of his young age, Georges is doing the best he can to collect money and have his own family and children. For this reason, he decided to have his own business, so he opened a snack shop in his town in 2008. He’s a respectable person known for his good place and delicious food. 

Today, he’s asking to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a freezer to be able to keep the food in good condition. In that way, he will gain people's trust and therefore, attract more customers. In the future, he plans to open his own restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer to be able to keep the food in good condition.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 30-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and four working siblings. He’s doing the best he can to support his father in order to offer them a fair way of living. He has been working as a car painter since 2005 and has already had eleven years of experience. 

Today, he’s requesting to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy the needed quantity of car paints and to renovate his garage. This will keep him up to date and offering good service to his customers. In the future, he plans to open a bigger garage where he can serve more clients.

loans.use: to buy the needed quantity of car paints and to renovate his garage.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 29-year-old Lebanese married man, living with his wife and two school-aged children. He’s working really hard to be able to pay his children’s educational fees. He has been working in the construction field for the past ten years. He’s a brave contractor who works with very high professionalism. 

Today, he wants to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase land for his new projects. This Kiva loan will allow him to carry on his work as it should be. In the future, he plans to expand his business and take on more projects both inside and outside the country.

loans.use: to purchase land for his new projects.

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is 24 years old, a married man who lives  together with his parents who are from Taiz, Yemen. He has been operating a general store for a long time on a stall in the town market in his area. He sells a variety of basic household products. He has managed to position his business in the market. It has a good reputation and is very accessible. It is a well-established business and many people come to it because they always find what they are looking for. He is very well-known and many people provide good references for him because he is noted for being an entrepreneurial man who is committed to his work. 

Ahmed has taken the decision to invest in his business so that he can keep it well stocked and attract more customers. This will allow him to increase his sales levels and his income, thereby enabling him to enjoy better living conditions.

Ahmed has decided to request a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to invest in his business, buying products such as rice, sugar, beans, corn, soap, oil, paper, eggs, salt and other products his customers would like. He hopes to expand his business to open a supermarket.

loans.use: to invest for his business, buying products such as rice, sugar, beans, corn, soap, oil, paper, eggs, salt, etc.

loans.name: Fuad

texts.en:
Fuad is a 26-year-old man who is always kind-hearted in his everyday life, according to the residents of his neighborhood. He got married and has two children. The burden of supporting his family is becoming heavier than ever, as he needs to cover his children's expenses in terms of living, education, and other things required by a big family. 

Fuad started his business long ago in order to cover the expenses imposed by his big family. His business was initially decorating shop windows that didn't require a large amount of capital except to purchase white cement and equipment for adornment and carving of windows. This business achieved a good reputation in old Sana'a, where it is located, and many people became regular customers. 

Fuad's family life was somewhat improved by the limited income from that business, but he did not stop at this point. He had some thoughts about further enlarging his business by opening a cafe next to this business selling food to his clients, a commonly sold food eaten as breakfast. 

Fuad was in need of a loan to start up the other business and visited one of Al-Amal Bank's branches. He  took a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB in order to pay the rent for the two shops and purchase needed materials like a large amount of white cement. In the future, he hopes to expand his business by opening a restaurant selling all types of food. He also hopes to build a house for his family and especially his children.

loans.use: to pay the rent for the two shops and purchase needed materials like a large amount of white cement for his business

loans.name: Taisyr

texts.en:
Taisyr is 30 years old, a married man with two children who lives in Taiz, Yemen with his loving family. He has owned a bakery for 14 years. 

He started his business two years ago and it is the only source of income for him and his family. He has attracted more clients and confined people. His business has continued running successfully and is more profitable. Due to the current bad situation in Yemen, he faces difficulty in the lack of gas leading him to sometimes have to close his business for a long time thus he has less profit from his enterprise and his customers are decreasing.

So he took a youth loan of 300,000 YER from AMB to buy more bakery items such as flour, gas, etc. for his business in order to make bread and distribute it to many shops. 

 In the future, he hopes to expand his business to purchase another shop and make it a gas cylinder store and also buy a car for transporting his business items.

loans.use: to buy more bakery needs such as flour, gas, etc. in order to make bread to distribute to many shops.

loans.name: Abdusalom

texts.ru: Абдусалом 1956 года рождения, у него 6 детей. Он работает пастух на ферме. Имея большой опыт скотоводства, он  дома также содержит скот овец, коз и корову. Его дети помогают в разведении скота.  Его невесты, весной начнут продавать молоко и молочные продукты. Абдусалом получил очередной кредит для увеличения поголовья скота. С каждого кредита он приобретает скот и вовремя сезона продав коз или овец, он улучшает свое благосостояние. За финансовую поддержку он благодарен Арванд и КИВА.
texts.en: Abdusalom was born in 1956. He has 6 children. Abdusalom is a herdsman on the farm. He is very experienced in livestock breeding, and there are sheep, goats and a cow on his farm. Abdusalom's children help him breed livestock. His daughters-in-law will start selling milk and dairy products in spring. Abdusalom got another loan to increase the number of livestock. The loans that he receives help Abdusalom purchase the livestock. He sells goats and sheep when market prices are high, and therefore makes a good profit.  Abdusalom thanks both MDO Arvand, LLC and KIVA for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer is a 23-year-old married man. He is the father of one child; he is working hard to provide him with the best living.

Amer has worked in fixing car bodies for 15 years; he started working when he was 8 years old. His childhood wasn't impressive at all since he didn't know the meaning of being a child.

In 2002, Amer started his own business. He started working in his house's backyard, and still does, but it has no rooftop. He really needs to build a roof in order to work easily during the winter season. He is using a plastic blanket to cover his working place, but it is impractical. That's why Amer applied for a  Youth Loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to build the necessary roof for his workplace.  

This is his first loan as an Al Majmoua borrower, and he believes that this loan will help him in expanding his business, increasing his income and providing his family with a good living and his child with a special loving and caring childhood.

loans.use: To build a necessary roof for his workplace.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 25-year-old married woman. Six years ago, Hanan started her own business from her house. She works as a hairdresser and most of her customers are friends, relatives and neighbors.

Her business is improving, but she has to put much effort in developing it to open her own future dream beauty salon. That's why Hanan applied for a Youth Loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy the necessary tools and equipment for improving her business.This is her second loan with Al Majmoua. Her previous loan helped a lot in supporting her business.

Hanan started her business from home because she didn't have enough capital to open a salon. She was trying to prove that when there is a will there is a way. She confirms that she was right and she will continue working on improving and developing her business to keep her customers pleased.

loans.use: To buy tools and equipment for her business

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 19-year-old single man. Five years ago Mohamad started his own business, dealing with manufacturing aluminum doors, closets & windows. He was too young to start a business, but he had his family to take care of and to help in making their living.

Mohamad is a hard worker, he insists on improving himself as much as he can. That's why he has applied for a Youth Loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary raw materials with special prices. 

Mohamad misses his childhood and hopes to expand his business in a way that when he thinks of making a family in the future, he has to be sure that his children will have a safe and healthy childhood with all their needs to be met. Mohamad insists on expanding his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy raw materials with special prices.

loans.name: Ikrom

texts.ru: Икрому 32 года, он женат. У него молодая семья, поэтому он должен хорошо зарабатывать, чтобы прокормить не только свою жену, но и помогать своим родителям пенсионерам.  Для этого они с отцом занимаются разведением коз. Их кишлак небольшой и основной работы у них нет. В основом многие едут в Российскую Федерацию и Казахстан, чтобы прокормить свою семью. Икром как и все ездил в Россию и присылал своим родителям деньги и даже копил на свадьбу. Теперь после свадьбы он по совету отца выводит скот для продажи на местный рынок. Настоящий кредит получает для покупки скота.
texts.en: Ikrom is 32 years old and married.  He has a young family and, hence, has to earn well in order to provide not only for his wife, but to help his retired parents.  This is why, his father and he are involved in breeding goats.  Their village is small, and they do not have a primary job.  Many people mainly go to the Russian Federation and Kazakhstan in order to provide for their families.  Ikrom went to Russia, just like everyone else, and sent money to his parents and even saved for the wedding.  Now, after the wedding, he, per his father's advice, takes livestock out for sale to the local market.  Ikrom is requesting this loan to purchase livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Ambaroy

texts.ru: Амбарой женщина средних лет,занимается предпринимательской деятельностью более 20ти лет и торгует женской и детской обувью на рынке.Имеет постоянную торговую точку и своих клиентов.Закупает товар по оптовой цене в оптовом рынке и продает по доступной цене.Более трёх лет кредитуется в нашей организации и начала с маленького оборота.Постепенно  расширилась и зарабатывает на жизнь стабильно.Хотя у Амбарой есть сыновья и муж,которые работают, она нуждается  в своих ресурсах ,так как у неё бывает много семейных расходов по проведению всяких мероприятий и она не хочет обременять своих сыновей.Она рада что работает с нами и всегда  рассчитывает на нашу поддержку в нужную минуту.
texts.en: Ambaroy is a middle-aged woman who has been engaged in business for over twenty years, selling women's and children's footwear. She maintains a permanent outlet at the market, and has regular clients. Ambaroy purchases her merchandise at a bulk price at the wholesale market, and resells it at affordable prices. She has been taking loans from MDO Arvand, LLC for over three years, having started with small-volume sales. Gradually, she expanded her business and now makes a stable income. Although Ambaroy has a husband and sons who are employed, she needs her own resources to cover the numerous family expenditures related to various events, as she does not want to burden her sons. She is glad to be working with MDO Arvand, LLC and always counts on their support in time of need.

loans.use: to buy a new lot of goods for her shop

loans.name: Ammar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client and is 29 years old, married, and has two children.

Ammar has been an owner of a food market since 2011, selling soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese, frozen beef, chicken and fish, dairy products, and household items. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $2,400 loan in order to make an aluminum showcases and to add more foodstuffs. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to make an aluminum showcase for his storefront and to add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 36 years old, married and has one child.

Ali is an owner of a shop since 2011, selling women’s clothing and accessories. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting $1800 loan in order to make glass showcase and to add more goods. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: in order to make glass storefront and to add more goods.

loans.name: Seif Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged 20-years-old. He is single and lives with four family members; two of them work.

Seif has been an owner of a shop selling perfumes since 2010. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of the local customers, and he knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He decided to apply for $2400 youth loan in order to pay the annual rent. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s life as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent.

loans.name: Meshreq

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq.  He is a youth client who is 30 years old, married and has three children.

Meshreq has been a carpenter since 2005; he makes living room, bedroom and all types of furniture.  He has sufficient experience in this field and a good reputation.  His workshop is located in a crowded area so there are a lot of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a $2,400 youth loan in order pay the annual rent for his workshop and to add more inventory.  He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: In order pay the annual rent for his workshop and to add more inventory.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. 24 years old, he is a youth client. He is single and lives with six family members, two of whom work.

Hussein has owned an electric generator since 2009. He leases electric lines for his area and surroundings. He has sufficient experience in this field and is well known for his good reputation in his area.

He decided to apply for a 2,500 USD youth loan to renovate the room for the generator. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To renovate the room for the generator.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged 27 years old and married.

Mahmoud has been a tailor since 2008; he makes, repairs, or alters clothing professionally such as suits, coats and trousers for men. He has more than four years experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is becoming well-known in the surrounding areas.

He decided to apply for a $1500 youth loan in order to purchase a split air conditioner for his workshop. He is aiming to earn more profits to improve his family’s life as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a split air conditioner for his workshop.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client who is 27 years old, married and has three children.

Hussein has been a tailor since 1990. He makes, repairs, or alters clothing professionally including suits, coats and trousers for men. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He decided to apply for a $3,000 youth loan in order to pay the annual rent for his workshop. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s life as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his workshop.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client who is 23 years old, single and lives with eight family members.

Alaa has been an owner of a food market since 2008, selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken and fish, and dairy products. He has a sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $2,400 youth loan to purchase an electrical generator for his market. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase an electrical generator for his market.

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a young client, 23 years old, and married.

He has owned a grocery since 2010, selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken and fish, and dairy products. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $2,400 youth loan in order to renovate his store. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: in order to renovate his grocery store.

loans.name: Lobiko Plus Group

texts.en:
Julienne, aged 60, is the chairwoman of the Community Bank “Lobiko Plus”, which is composed of 11 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through the MFI HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Julienne has been in business for years. She sells fresh food at the market located north-east of the city of Kinshasa. She is a loyal client of the MFI HOPE RDC who has already received seven different loans and has repaid them properly. As the fresh food demand is high in her community, she intends to use the next loan to increase her stock of fresh food, reselling it with the aim of increasing her profits. Each month, her business brings in a profit of US$300. 

Her ambition is to someday become a fresh food wholesaler in her environment. Julienne is a widow and has five children, who are aged between 20 and 30 years old. Two of them go to school.

loans.use: to increase the fresh food’s stock and reselling at profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
Raed is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged 29 years old, is married and has two children. He lives with his family.

Raed has owned a furniture gallery since 2000, selling sofas, tables and bedroom furniture. He has sufficient experience in this field and a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $2400 youth loan in order to pay the annual rent for his gallery. He is aiming to earn more profits so he can provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his gallery.

loans.name: Dalia Group

texts.es:
Valentina cuenta con 49 años de edad, vive en unión libre tiene un hijo que esta estudiando la preparatoria 1° grado su esposo se llama Carmelo es campesino, ella se dedica al comercio vende frutas y verduras ya tiene 4 años con el negocio e invertirá su préstamo en la compra de frutas y verduras como son: manzana, cebolla, chiles, jitomate, lechuga, naranjas, etc.  Doña valentina dice que le gustaría que su negocio creciera un poco mas ella dice que esta trabajando para sacar adelante el negocio y su familia espera que el negocio incremente ya que ella esta haciendo el mayor esfuerzo.

Valentina pertenece al grupo dalia el cual esta integrado por 11 personas las cuales todas son mujeres trabajadoras a continuación serán mencionadas: Humberta, Areli, Abida, Faustina, Sandra, Liobarda, Irene, Lourdes, Eladia, Gerarda, Valentina, todas realizan una actividad comercial como son: venta de frutas, verduras, quesos, abarrotes, comida, pollos, plástico, etc.
texts.en:
Valentina is 49 years old and lives with her partner Carmelo and son who is a student at a school for adults. Carmelo is an agricultural worker.

Valentina earns a living by selling fruit and vegetables such as apples, onions, chiles, jitomate, lettuce, and oranges. She says she would like her business to grow a little more. She and her family want to see her business do well as she is working hard to make this happen. 

She belongs to the Dahlia group which has eleven members. All are hardworking women. Their names are Humberta, Areli, Abida, Faustina, Sandra, Liobarda, Irene, Lourdes, Eladia, Gerarda, and lastly Valentina herself. They run businesses such as selling fruit, vegetables, cheese, groceries, food, chickens, and plastic goods.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables such as apples, onions, chiles, jitomate, lettuce, and oranges

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel, tiene la edad de 33 años, está en unión libre,  vive con su esposa e hijos que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito pretende comprar terneros para su posterior engorde. El cuenta con un terreno apto para la explotación de estos animales y así poder sacarlos en un tiempo rápido para la venta. El con estos animales quiere generar el máximo de las ganancias a la hora de la venta para mejorar su nivel de vida y su estabilidad económica para su bienestar familiar.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Miguel is 33 years old and in a live in relationship.  He lives with his partner and children who are his top priority.  He will use the money from this loan to buy steers that he will fatten up.  He has the land on which to raise these animals and will be able to sell them quickly.  He wants to maximize his earnings with these animals so that he can improve his quality of life and financial stability for his family’s well-being.  This will be his first loan through FUDECOSUR.  He has not had any previous conventional loans, but FUDECOSUR has provided the loan with ease and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy steers.

loans.name: Huriniso

texts.ru: Хуринисо женщина , которая помогает мужу по откорму скота. Она живёт вместе со своим сыном у которого жена и двое детей. Сам на заработках в России. Хуринисо каждый день выводит своих коров на пастбище пастись, а вечером заводит и доит их молоко. Она имеет не большой доход от продажи молока, пока у неё две коровы. На полученный кредит она хочет купить ещё пару  молодых коров и откормив в зимний период, продать за хорошую цену. Она благодарна организации и инвесторам за финансирование и понимание.
texts.en:
Huriniso assists her husband in their cattle-fattening business. She lives with her son's wife and two children, while the son is away working in Russia. Every morning, Huriniso takes out the cows to graze and then brings them back in the evening for milking. Because she owns only two cows, money, generated from selling the milk, is low. 
Receiving a loan would allow get to purchase a couple of cows, fatten them during winter, and then sell with profit. She thanks the organization and investors for financing and assistance.

loans.use: to fatten cattle.

loans.name: Ibrohim

texts.ru: Иброхим мужчина 33 лет, отец пятерых детей. Он живёт в пригорном районе, где мужчины в основном занимаются и имеют доход на жизнь от бизнеса откорма и продажи скота. А также по профессии Иброхим сам дехканин, он выращивает арахис и продаёт его оптом торговцам. Но сейчас на полученный кредит он планирует купить несколько голов баранов и коз. Он уже второй раз получает кредит и он благодарит, что благодаря кредиту он смог увеличить поголовье скота.
texts.en:
Ibrohim is thirty-three years old and the father of five children. He lives in a mountainous region, where men have historically made a living by fattening, breeding and selling cattle. Ibrohim also works on a collective (dekhan) farm, where he grows arachis and sells it in bulk. 
A loan would allow him to purchase several heads of sheep and goats. This is his second loan and the thanks everyone that helped him receive his first loan. With it, he was able to increase his herd.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Saidhomid

texts.ru: Саидхомид занимается торговлей. Он в основном продает газированные напитки и натуральные соки. Ему 33 года. Торговлей Саидхомид занимается пять лет. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Он берет кредит для покупки других видов натуральных соков, колы и спрайта.
texts.en: Saidhomid is in retail business. He mainly sells sparkling drinks and natural juices. He is 33 years old. Saidhomid has been in this business for five years. He is married and has four children. He is taking out the loan to purchase a variety of natural juices and soft drinks.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of natural juices and soft drinks.

loans.name: Rossanna Vanessa

texts.es:
Rossanna Vanessa tiene 28 años es casada, vive con el esposo y con un hijo de 5 años. Vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

La Ventanilla EL SAGRADO CORAZON, esta ventanilla se encuentra ubicada en el sector de las calles Ernesto Briones y Parroquia 10 de Noviembre, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica al Comercio.

La señora Rossanna Vanessa se dedica al negocio de Yambal, es decir a la venta de cosméticos por medio de revistas y a dar asesoría de belleza.El credito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos de Yambal para el negocio

Las compras de los insumos las realiza en la ciudad de Guayaquil por medio de correo electrónico. El crédito les ayudado a aumentar la producción y tener productos de calidad, el sueño de Rossanna es aumentar el negoció, ha enfrentado desafíos como los precios altos y la competencia.
En los tiempos libres le gusta ver la televisión y pasear por el campo.
texts.en:
Rossanna Vanessa is 28 years old and lives with her husband of five years in the Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos settlement.

The EL SAGRADO CORAZON neighborhood, located in the area of the intersection of Ernesto Briones and Parroquia 10 de Noviembre streets is part of the Ventanas settlement.  This is an area of merchants.

Rossanna Vanessa is a businesswoman and sells Yambal products; that is cosmetics through catalogs.  She also gives beauty advice.  She will use the money from this loan to Yambal products for her business.
 
She will order her supplies through email from the city of Guayaquil.  The loan has helped her increase her productivity and have quality products.  Rossanna’s dream is to grow her business.  She’s faced challenges such as high prices and competition.

In her spare time she likes to watch television and go for walks in the woods.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Tofiq

texts.ru: Tofiq razvodit skot vo dvore svoego doma dla prodaji masya na bazare. Tak on zarabativaet dengi I soderjit svoyu semyu. Emu 58 let, on jenat, u nego dvoe detey I dva vnuka. On zanimaetsa etim 20 let, na segodnashniy den u nego odna korova I bichok. Tofiq xochet dengi dla postroyki kuxni I vannoy komnati u seba doma. Iza otsustviya udobstv v dome ego semye prixoditsa ne legko. Emu nujno 1000 AZN dla remonta.
texts.en: Tofiq has a corral outside his house. He raises cattle and sells the meat at the market.  By doing this, he makes a living and provides for his family. Tofiq is 58 years old, married, has two children and two grandchildren. He has been engaged in this business for 20 years. As of today, he owns one cow and a calf. Tofiq would like to get money to build a kitchen and a bathroom in his house. Life without conveniences is very difficult for Tofiq and his family. Tofiq needs 1,000 AZN for the repairs.

loans.use: To build a kitchen and a bathroom in the house.

loans.name: Omar

texts.es: Omar, tiene la edad de 58 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa que es su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito va comprar los insumos para la asistencia de su cafetal, como lo son el abono y los químicos necesarios. El cuenta con un área muy buena ya sembrada de café y lo que quiere es asistirla para mejorar la producción este próximo año. El tiene como meta aumentar su cosecha  y generar más ganancias para tener un futuro más estable económicamente y mejor bienestar familiar cada día. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Omar is 58 years old and married.  He lives with his wife, and she is his greatest priority.

He will use the loan to buy supplies to care for his coffee crops.  He will buy things he needs like natural and chemical fertilizers.  He has a very good area that has already been planted with coffee.  What he wants to do is care for the crops in order to improve production this coming year.

His goal is to increase his harvest and to generate more income.  He wants to do this in order to have a more stable financial future and to improve his family’s daily well-being.

This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not had any previous loans with state banks.  However, FUDESCOSUR has given him a loan with the easiest terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy natural and chemical fertilizers for his crops.

loans.name: Carlos Virgilio

texts.es:
Carlos Virgilio  tiene 56  años es casado, vive con la esposa tiene 4 hijos todos son mayores de edad y no vive con él. Vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

La Ventanilla EL SAGRADO CORAZON, esta ventanilla se encuentra ubicada en el sector de las calles Ernesto Briones y Parroquia 10 de Noviembre, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica al Comercio.

El señor Carlos Virgilio se dedica al trabajo de Ebanista, es decir a la confección de muebles de madera.necesita el credito para la compra de madera, clavos y tapìs para los muebles.

Las compras de los insumos las realiza en la ciudad de Ventas donde el Señor Juan Arevalo. El crédito les ayudado a aumentar la producción y tener productos de calidad, el sueño de Carlos Virgilio es tener un negocio más grande, ha enfrentado desafíos como los precios altos de madera que es la materia prima.

En los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte y ver la televisión
texts.en: Carlos Virgilio is 56, married, and lives with his wife and 4 children, who are all adults living independently. He lives in the Ventanas district of Los Rios Province.  The EL SAGRADO CORAZON group is located on calles Ernesto Briones y Parroquia 10 de Noviembre, in Ventanas district and is engaged in sales. Carlos Virgilio works making wood furniture.  He seeks credit to buy wood, nails and cloth for furniture.  He buys these items in the city of Ventas from Juan Arevalo.  He seeks this loan to increase production and make quality products.  His dream is to grow his business, and he confronts challenges such as the high cost of his prime material: wood.  In his free time, Carlos Virgilio enjoys sports and watching TV.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails and cloth for furniture

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: El Joven Ricardo es soltero, tiene 19  años de edad, Ricardo   estudia Contabilidad  en una universidad privada de prestigio, Ricardo escogió esta carrera ya que es su vocación y tiene las capacidades y habilidades para desarrollarse profesionalmente, Su sueño de Ricardo  es brindarle a sus padres una mejor calidad de vida y de alguna forma devolverle a ellos todo lo que hicieron por él, con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para pagar su matrícula y  prácticas profesionales, Ricardo cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran
texts.en: Young Ricardo is single and is 19 years old. Ricardo studies accounting in a prestigious, private university.
