One of the members is Gladys, who has a well-stocked shop that supplies her neighborhood.  She is a very hardworking woman.  She starts work every day very early and works until late into the night.  Her goal is to continue growing her business to increase her income.  She is requesting a loan to purchase flour, cheese, fideo pasta, rice, oil, yerba, sugar, salt etc., which she will be able to use to stock her store.

loans.use: to purchase staple items for sale.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Danil es un joven de 26 años de edad, el cual vive con su esposa e hijos, en  la Fuente, en la provincia de Cartago. El principal sistema de drenaje de esta zona es el río Reventazón que nace en el Cerro Cuericí. Por la fertilidad de sus suelos volcánicos y aluviales, Cartago es el centro de población que tiene en la agricultura y ganadería sus principales fuentes económicas.

El inicio su negocio con dos vacas que le heredo su padre y con las crías ha ido aumentando. Desde hace varios años que Danil tiene este negocio del ganado lechero, ya que cuenta en estos momentos con una propiedad, pero le falta lo principal para que su negocio surja y para que los vecinos de su comunidad se vean beneficiados.  El proyecto le es muy interesante.

Actualmente Danil está solicitando un micro crédito de ¢500.000 (quinientos mil colones) para la compra de dos vacas lecheras más, para poder continuar con su producción de leche y de queso. Con esto el espera hacer crecer su negocio, ya que su meta es tener un mejor resultado en su trabajo para obtener una excelente calidad de vida tanto para él como la de su familia. 

Danil es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Fuente Agrícola, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Con este préstamo, él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Daniel is a young man of 26 who lives together with his wife and children in La Fuente, in Cartago province.  The main drainage channel in this area is the Reventazón River which has its source in the Cuericí Hills.  Owing to the fertile nature of its volcanic and alluvial soil, the main sources of income in this area are farming and livestock raising.

Daniel started his business with two cows that he inherited from his father and, with their offspring, he has increased his herd.  Daniel has been in the dairy business for several years.  He has property but lacks the money he needs to make progress in his business and to ensure that the neighbors in his community benefit.  The project is very interesting to him.

Daniel is requesting a micro loan for 500,000 colones to buy two additional dairy cows so that he can continue producing milk and cheese.  In this way, he hopes to grow his business as his goal is to obtain better results from his work in order to provide both himself and his family with an excellent quality of life.

Daniel is a member of the Fuente Agrícola community loan company, one of 150 such organizations which are associated with EDESA in Costa Rica.  He hopes to use his loan to continue growing on both a personal and financial level whilst participating actively within the loan organization in his community.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows

loans.name: Maura

texts.en:
Maura is sixty-three years old and lives in San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City. She is married with five children. 

Maura has a snack-vending business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase raw ingredients for her snack-vending business. 

Maura has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Maura hopes to earn money in order to help her husband and improve their lives.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack-vending business.

loans.name: Alona's Group

texts.en:
Alona is forty-five years old and lives in San Roque, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with eight children. 

To earn a living, Alona has a business selling snacks. She earns about PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. Alona has requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to purchase additional ingredients and raw materials for her snack-vending business.

Alona has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Alona would like to introduce her products to another location. Alona is the leader of a two-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and ingredients for her snacks business.

loans.name: Glory Fe

texts.en:
Glory Fe is married with three children. Glory Fe is 52 years old and lives in Taguima, Tudela.

Glory Fe is a farmer and grows rice crops to earn a living. Glory Fe has been doing this for 10 years. Glory Fe has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase additonal fertilizer for planting rice crops.

Glory Fe has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Glory Fe hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additonal fertilizer for planting rice crops

loans.name: Dolorita

texts.en:
Dolorita is married with four children. Dolorita is 40 years old and lives in Estrella, Sinacaban.

Dolorita is a farmer and grows corn crops to earn a living. Dolorita has been doing this for 20 years. Dolorita has requested a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional fertilizers for planting crops. 

Dolorita has been a member of PMPC for five months. In the future, Dolorita hopes to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers for planting crops

loans.name: Agapita

texts.en:
Agapita is 45 years old and lives in Estrella, Sinacaban. Agapita is married with four children. 

Agapita has a general store that sells a variety of products. Agapita has had this business for 20 years. Agapita requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.  

Agapita has been a member of PMPC for five months.  In the future, Agapita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 44 years old and lives in Estrella, Sinacaban. Alicia is married with five children. 

Alicia has a general store that sells a variety of products. Alicia has had this business for 15 years. Alicia requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.
 
Alicia has been a member of PMPC for five months. In the future, Alicia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Sabrina

texts.en: Sabrina, a 38-year-old married mother of one, lives in Estrella, Sinacaban where she has been operating a dress shop that sells dress-making materials for three years. A member of PMPC for four months, Sabrina is requesting a loan of PHP 10000 to purchase additional dress-making materials. In  the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional dress-making materials.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is fifty-one years old and lives in Poblacion, Sinacaban. Florencia is married with two children.
 
To earn a living, Florencia has a business selling food snacks. Florencia earns about PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. Florencia has requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to purchase additional ingredients such as sugar, oil, etc.

Florencia has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Florencia would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients such as sugar and oil.

loans.name: Maritchel

texts.en:
Maritchel is thirty years old and lives in Estrella, Sinacaban. Maritchel is married with two children.
 
To earn a living, Maritchel has a business selling snacks in the local community. Maritchel earns about PHP 1,200 each month doing this type of work. 
Maritchel has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase additional ingredients such as sugar, oil, etc.

Maritchel has been a member of PMPC for five months. In the future, Maritchel would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients such as sugar and oil.

loans.name: Purita

texts.en:
Purita is sixty-five years old and lives in Libertad,Bajo, Sinacaban. Purita is married with four children. 

Purita has a general store that sells variety of products. Purita has had this business for thirty years. Purita requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

Purita has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Purita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages and detergents.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecelia is fifty-three years old and lives in Aguada, Ozamiz City. She is single.

Cecilia has a boarding house business and earns approximately PHP 7,100 each month doing this type of business. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase materials for her boarding house.

Cecilia has been a member of PMPC for four months. In the future, Cecilia hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her boarding house.

loans.name: Amanda Lissett

texts.es: Amanda es una joven estudiante de la carrera de Ingeniería en Sistemas, también estudia un curso de diseño gráfico. Está solicitando el crédito para la compra de una computadora, y así poder poner en práctica los conocimientos adquiridos y también hacer sus investigaciones. Dentro de algunos años se ve hablando inglés con otras personas, extranjeros. Y siendo jefa del departamento de sistemas de una empresa grande. La computadora sería su herrmaienta de estudio. Su hermana le apoyó en el pago de un curso de inglés.
texts.en: Amanda is young student studying systems engineering.  She is also studying graphic design. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase a computer. She can put into practice her acquired skills and also do research. In a few years, she sees herself speaking English with other people, like foreigners. She also sees herself being the systems manager at a big company. The computer would be a study tool. Her sister supports her with the payment for an English course.

loans.use: purchase a computer.

loans.name: Octavia

texts.es: Octavia, de 57 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos pequeños hijos de 20 y 15 años respectivamente. Juntos viven en su propia donde reina la paz. La actividad que realiza Octavia, es muy trabajoso pero ella dice: “que no hay nada difícil en la vida, con la finalidad de tener buena salud y un buen bienestar”; Octavia sabe las dificultades de trabajar en el campo y sobre todo para una mujer; es por eso que su esposo y sus hijos la ayudan en los deberes. Hace 35 años que empezó a labrar la tierra; desde muy tempranas horas se dirigía a su chacra no importaba si hacia lluvia pero tenia que mantener sus plantas alejadas de las plagas que afectan. Por tal motivo acuden a MFP para solicitar un préstamo que ayude con sus planes de trabajo. Con el tiempo desea en incrementar con más plantas de café; porque sabe que son beneficiosos con las ventas y de esa manera obtener una estabilidad económica. Este será su crédito número 05 con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus respectivos pagos, además está seguro que con su grupo comunal llegara muy lejos, ya que le trae muchos beneficios. Con los 500 nuevos soles, le dará un mantenimiento adecuado a sus plantaciones de café respectivamente, para ello comprará insumos y abonos de primera calidad.
texts.en: Octavia is 57 years old, she is married and has 2 children who are 20 and 15. They live together peacefully in their own home. Octavia’s work demands a lot of effort, but she says: “Nothing is hard in life when you aim to have good health and wellbeing”. Octavia knows about the difficulties of working in the fields, especially for a woman; it is for this reason that her husband and children help her out. She started plowing the land 35 years ago. She went to her fields very early, no matter if it was raining; she had to keep the pests that affected her plants away from them.   It is for this reason that she has turned to MFP to request a loan that will help her carry out her work plans. In time, she wants to increase the number of coffee plants she has, because she knows the crop sells well and they will help her to achieve economic stability. This will be her fifth loan with MFP, and she is committed to continue paying on time. In addition, she is sure that she will go far with her community group, as it provides her with many benefits. With the 500 Nuevos Soles of the loan, she will provide her coffee plantations with adequate maintenance. She will buy high quality inputs and fertilizers for this.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Paulina de 26 años, es una mujer amable, vive en su propia casa junto a sus 02 queridos hijos, Carlos de 09 años y Gabriela de 06 años; a quien desea una mejor calidad de vida. Paulina, es una mujer de trabajo, le gusta la vida del campo, hace 10 años empezó a laborar cultivando plantas café, que con gran esfuerzo ah logrado obtener. En tiempos de cosecha normalmente pide el apoyo de los jornaleros para que puedan extraer de manera fácil sus frutos, Paulina considera que lo más difícil es no poder combatir con las plagas que afectan la producción de sus plantas. Por ello desde que se entero sobre los préstamos que MFP realizaba pues no dudo en acercarse para consultar con su asesor; ahora gracias al apoyo puede cumplir con sus planes de trabajo. Este será su crédito número 02 con MFP, por el cual se compromete a pagar de manera puntual, además respalda a su grupo comunal por la buena organización que tienen. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, le servirá para darle un mantenimiento adecuado a su producto como el café , comprando insumos y abonos.
texts.en: Twenty-six-year-old Paulina is a kind woman.  She lives in her own home with her two beloved children, nine-year-old Carlos and six-year-old Gabriela, for whom she wants a better quality of life.  Paulina is a hardworking woman who likes to live in the country.  Through a lot of effort, she was able to get coffee plants and start cultivating them ten years ago.  During harvest season she normally asks for the help of laborers to collect her produce more easily.  Paulina tells us that the most difficult thing is not being able to fight the pests that affect her plants' production.  That is why, as soon as she found out about the loans MFP gave out, she didn't hesitate to go for a consultation with her adviser.  Now, thanks to their help, she can carry out her work plans.  This will be her second loan with MFP and she promises to make her payments on time.  She also supports her communal group because of its good organization.  With the 1,000 nuevos soles, she will give her produce, such as coffee, the maintenance it needs by buying supplies and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca, de 60 años es una mujer amable. Vive en compañía de sus 2 hijas: Rosa maría y Marisa a quienes cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Cajas. 
Gracias a su trabajo y sacrificio pudo obtener muchos terrenos agrícolas y construir su acogedora casa, donde cuidó de sus hijos, todos ellos son mayores e independientes. Ahora su vida se centra en el cuidado de sus animales, cuenta con 87 cuyes, 4 ovejas y una vaca, los cuales cuida con mucha dedicación. Su secreto es sembrar alfalfa, el cual utiliza como alimento. Además acondicionó una habitación de su casa para la venta de comida los fines de semana, ya la conocen sobre todo por los ricos platos que cocina. Además siembra maíz del cuzco en sus terrenos agrícolas, para esta temporada solo utilizó una parcela, pues las demás los alquilo a buen precio. Hoy en día espera obtener una buena cosecha, ya que trabajó mucho en su cuidado. Ahora desea incrementar su ganado, ya que hace poco vendió un promedio de 300 cuyes y para la próxima temporada tiene que abastecer su ganado para la venta. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “San Lorenzo” y este es el décimo segundo crédito con MFP, donde agradece al apoyo de todos ustedes, ya que obtendrá el préstamo que necesita para lograr sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues los integrantes de su asociación son responsables y solidarios.
Francisca de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus cultivos de alfalfa, que le servirá para el alimento de sus animales.
texts.en: Francisca is 60 years old and a very nice woman.  She lives with her two daughters: Rosa María and Marisa, who she cares for in her own home, located in the city of Cajas.  Thanks to her work and her sacrifice she has been able to obtain a lot of agricultural land and to build a welcoming home, where she cared for her children, all of whom are now older and more independent.  Now her life focuses on caring for her animals.  She has 87 guinea pigs, 4 sheep and one cow, and she cares for them with great dedication.  Her secret is planting alfalfa, which she uses to feed them.  In addition, she has prepared a room in her house that she uses to sell meals on the weekends.  Now her customers know her for the tasty dishes that she makes.  She also plants corn from Cuzco on her agricultural land.  This season she only used one parcel because she rented the other land for a good price.  Currently she hopes to obtain a good harvest, since she has worked hard caring for the crop.  Now she wants to increase her livestock, since recently she sold an average of 300 guinea pigs and for next season she needs to stock up on her livestock for sale.  She belongs to the communal bank "San Lorenzo" and this is her 12th loan from Kiva field partner MFP.  She is grateful for all of your support, since she will obtain the loan that she needs in order to achieve her goals.  In addition, she promises to be punctual with her loan repayments, since the members of her association are responsible and unified.  Francisca, if she receives your help, will invest the requested money in the purchase of natural fertilizers to spread on her alfalfa crops, which will help her feed her animals.

loans.use: To purchase natural fertilizers

loans.name: Sara Esther

texts.es:
La señora Sara Esther esta agradecida por su cooperación en el crédito anterior el cual pudo realizar la mejorar de los acabados del exterior e interior que a su vivienda le estaba haciendo falta. 
Esta nueva mente solicitando un préstamo para la elaboración de la barda alrededor se su vivienda, ya que no cuenta con la seguridad necesaria para que su pequeño hijo pueda salir a jugar con mas confianza. 
No cuenta con el material necesario que es arena, cemento, block, varilla y pagarle a la Perona que se encargara de realizar la barda, es por eso que solicita un crédito y así mejorar el patrimonio y la seguridad de su familia. 
Con una parte de su sueldo que obtiene de su empleo de una fábrica pagara el crédito ya que es madre soltera y tiene a su hijo bajo su responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Sara Esther is grateful for your cooperation in her previous loan which enabled her to make some needed improvements to the outside and inside of her home.

She is requesting a new loan to build a perimeter wall around her property as she doesn't have the security she needs to let her young son go outside to play without worrying.

Sara Esther does not have the materials she needs (sand, cement, blocks and iron), nor the money to pay the person who will build the wall.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan.  In this way, she will improve her family's assets and also their security.

Sara Esther will repay her loan with the salary that she makes from her job in a factory.  She is a single mother and has responsibility for her son.

loans.use: to build a perimeter wall around her property

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a 36-year-old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 6 months to 10 years. He describes himself to be an honest man. He operates a tailoring retail store where he sells clothes such as dresses, trousers, skirts, shirts, etc. He has been involved in this business for 10 years and employs one staff member. His business is located in a densely populated area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for expanding the business. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase more cloth and materials. Moses's business goal is to own a boutique within five years.

loans.use: to buy more cloth and materials for making dresses to sell.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence is a 44-year-old married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 1 to 8 years. He describes himself to be an honest man. He operates a farm where he sells maize and potatoes. He has been involved in this business for 20 years. His business is located in a densely populated area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for expanding the business. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase seeds for planting. Lawrence business goal is to be a large-scale farmer within five years.

loans.use: to buy more maize and potato seeds for planting.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 4 years to 14 years. She describes herself to be a self-motivated woman. She operates a retail store where she sells items such as salt, bread, sugar, fertilizers, herbicides,  etc. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a populated area and local residents and farmers are her primary customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low purchasing power for commodities such as fertilizers and herbicides. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more household products, fertilizers and herbicides. Mary's hope and dream is to run another a similar retail store within five years.

loans.use: to buy more household products, fertilizer and herbicides for resale.

loans.name: Nellie

texts.en:
Nellie is married with six children. Nellie is 62 years old and lives in Libertad, Bajo, Sinacaban.

Nellie is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. Nellie has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase additional feed for raising her pigs. 

Nellie has been a member of PMPC for  6 years. In the future, Nellie hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for raising pigs

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 32-year-old married man. He has two children,  2 years and 5 years old. He describes himself to be a hardworking man. He operates a retail store where he sells charcoal. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a residential area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be shortage of charcoal for resale. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase more charcoal to sell. John's  business goal is to venture into new business of selling fuel within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will run another charcoal-selling retail store.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 58 years old and lives in Libertad, Bajo, Sinacaban. Teresita is single with one child. 

To earn a living, Teresita has a business selling snacks in the local community. Teresita earns about PHP 2000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase additional ingredients such as sugar, oil, etc.

Teresita has been a member of PMPC for six years.  In the future, Teresita would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients such as sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Vivincia

texts.en:
Vivincia is married with five children. Vivincia is 46 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin.

Vivincia is a farmer and grows  vegetable crops to earn a living. Vivincia has been doing this for 15 years. Vivincia has requested a loan of 14,900 to purchase additional fertilizers for planting crops.
 
Vivincia has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Vivincia hopes to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers for planting crops

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia, a 57-year-old married mother of nine, lives in Pan-ay, Clarin where she has been growing rice crops to earn a living for 35 years. A member of PMPC for two years, Virginia is requesting a loan of PHP 50000 to purchase additional fertilizers for planting crops. In  the future, she hopes to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers for planting crops.

loans.name: Ambition Group

texts.fr:
Mme Balkissa est la représentante du groupe AMBITION. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus  âgée 19ans et le moins âgée a 09ans.02  vont  à l’école et elle a 03 personnes à sa charge.

Mme vend des  friperies ; de pagnes et gère un kiosque. Elle exerce le métier de vente d’habits  depuis 03ans et le métier de gérant de kiosque depuis 01an. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de  paglayiri pour friperies et pagnes. Ses clients sont les  hommes et femmes.

Mme veut  s’acheter  01 balle de friperie ; 10 pièces de pagnes et 15 caisses de boissons.

Elle épargne ses bénéfices pour  agrandir son commerce. Mme ambitionne  s’acheter une parcelle pour son activité de kiosque et s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Balkissa represents the AMBITION group.  She is married and the mother of three children.  The oldest is 19 and the youngest is 9. Two of them go to school and she has three people in her care. 

She sells second hand clothing and pagnes (colorful lengths of cloth used to make clothing) and runs a kiosk. She has been selling clothing for three years and running a kiosk for a year. She gets her supplies at the Paglayiri market where she can buy clothing and pagnes.  She has male and female customers.

Mrs. Balkissa wants to buy one bundle of clothing, ten pagnes and 15 cases of drinks. 

She is saving her profits in order to build up her business.  Her goal is to buy herself a parcel of land for her kiosk business and to be able to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy one bundle of clothing, ten pagnes and 15 cases of drinks.

loans.name: Tobias

texts.en: Tobias is a 24-year-old young single man. He has no children yet. He describes himself to be an intelligent man. He operates a welding retail store where he sells metal doors, windows, beds, etc. He has been involved in this business for four years and employs two staff members. His business is located in a densely populated area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for expanding the business. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase more metal. Tobias's business goal is to be a supplier of metal items within five years. He hopes that in the future he will expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more metal.

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily is married with three children. Lily is 50 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin.

Lily is a farmer and grows rice crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. Lily has requested a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase additional fertilizers for planting crops. 

Lily has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Lily hopes to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers for planting crops

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 54 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin. Julieta is married with one child. 

To earn a living, Julieta has a business selling meats in the local community. She earns about PHP 12,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 35,000 to purchase additional meats to sell.

Julieta has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Julieta would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional meats to sell

loans.name: Aldo

texts.es: Aldo es socio del Banco Comunal 28 de Noviembre, tiene 39 años y se dedica a la venta de ganado. Aldo es padre de 5 hijos. A él le encanta ahorrar, y menciona que aprendió a ahorrar en FINCA Perú. Aldo está agradecido a FINCA Perú porque todos en su comunidad lo conocen como un socio puntual y eso lo ha ayudado con su negocio. Gracias a las capacitaciones, Aldo aprendió cómo invertir mejor en su negocio y como administrar el dinero. Para Aldo, FINCA Perú es más que una institución, es una familia. Aldo invertirá su préstamo en la compra de ganado.
texts.en: Aldo is a member of the November 28th Communal Bank.  He is 39 years old and sells cattle.  Aldo is the father of five children.  He enjoys saving and mentioned that he learned how to save from FINCA Peru.  Aldo is grateful to FINCA Peru because everyone in his community knows that he is a puncutal member, which has helped him with his business.  Thanks to the training classes, Aldo learned how to invest better in his business and manage his money.  For Aldo, FINCA Peru is more than an institution -- it is a family.  Aldo will invest his loan in the purchase of cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 51 years old and lives in Tigdok, Tudela. Lilia is widowed with three children.
 
Lilia has a store that sells a variety of products. Lilia has had this business for 15 years. Lilia requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.
 
Lilia has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Lilia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is married with six children. Juanita is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Juanita is a farmer and grows vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for nine years. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and seedlings.

Juanita has been a member of PMPC for 11 years. In the future, Juanita hopes to have a good harvest.

loans.use: To pay for bags of fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal 28 de Noviembre, tiene 34 años y se dedica a la venta de ganado con su familia. Victoria es madre de 5 hijos y es socia de FINCA Perú hace 5 años. Ella está muy agradecida porque las sesiones le enseñaron como criar a sus hijos, a ser responsable y puntual. El negocio de Victoria ha progresado mucho, desde pequeña siempre trabajó en la chacra, pero ahora trabaja mejor con metas a futuro y viendo como crecen sus ahorros. Con su nuevo préstamo, Victoria comprará más ganado para engorde.
texts.en: Victoria is a member of the November 28th Communal Bank.  She is 34 years old and sells cattle with her family.  Victoria is the mother of five children and has been a member of FINCA Peru for five years.  She is very grateful because the sessions have taught her how to raise her children and to become responsible and punctual.  Victoria's business has made much progress.  From a young age, she has always worked in the fields but now she works better because she sets goals for the future and knows how to grow her savings.  With this new loan, Victoria will buy more cattle for fattening.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras De Corcona Group

texts.es: Lidia es una joven madre  de 24 años de edad es separada con 01 hijo aún dependiente, ella pertenece a la Alcancía Comunal “Las Emprendedoras de Corcona” la cual está integrada por 08 socias, la mayoría vecinas del mismo lugar. A raíz de su separación y  la  responsabilidad de tener a su hijo a su cargo decide emprender su propio  negocio, actualmente cuenta con una bodega, siendo  su única fuente de ingreso, Lidia ha tenido que trabajar mucho para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo. Ella se siente orgullosa pues con su esfuerzo a podido emprender su propio negocio y de mejorar su vivienda. El crédito le servirá para invertir en su negocio comprando gaseosas, verduras, leche y fideos y de esta manera tener surtido su bodega. La Alcancía Comunal “Las Emprendedoras de Corcona” agradecen la ayuda brindada y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien con el Programa- Prosperidad. Adjuntamos la fotografía de Estela.
texts.en:
Lidia is a young 24-year-old mother.  She is separated with one child, still dependent.  She belongs to Las Emprendedoras de Corcona Communal Bank, which is made up of eight members, the majority of them neighbors from the same place.

Because of her separation and the responsibility of being in charge of her son, she decided to launch her own business.  Currently she has a general store, her only source of income.  Lidia has had to work a lot to give a better quality of life to her son.  She is proud because with her effort she has been able to launch her own business and improve her home.

She will use the loan to invest in her business, buying soda, vegetables, milk, and noodles, and in this way stock her general store.

Las Emprendedoras de Corcona Communal Bank is grateful for the help given and they promise to continue working well with Programa Prosperidad.

We attach the photograph of Estela.

loans.use: to buy soda, vegetables, milk, and noodles.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is 61 years old and lives in Balanlinao. She is married with two children. 

Cresencia has a business buying and selling crabs. She earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase boxes of crabs.
 
Cresencia has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Cresencia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase boxes of crabs to sell

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is married with three children. She is 49 years old and lives in Mansabay Alto, Lopez Jaena.

Evangeline sells assorted goods like sardines, shampoo, and cooking oil to earn a living and has had this business for 20 years. Each month, she earns PHP 4,500 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to pay for boxes of sardines, shampoo, cooking oil by the gallon, and shampoo by the dozen.

Evangeline has been a member of PMPC for 11 years. In the future, Evangeline hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase boxes of sardines, shampoo, cooking oil by the gallon, and shampoo by the dozen.

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Alto, Lopez Jaena , Misamis Occi

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 49 years old, married, and has seven children. She lives in the Philippines.  Elizabeth is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living, which she has been doing for nine  years. 

Elizabeth is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase materials for her house renovation.  Elizabeth has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, she hopes to save for her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase materials for house renovation

loans.name: Banco Mujer Avanzando Juntas Group

texts.es:
Ingrid es la presidenta de Banco Mujer Avanzando Juntas , tiene mucha experiencia  en el liderazgo del grupo, este es el tercer préstamo que solicita el banco, ella comercializa todo tipo de mercadería, desde ropa, zapatos, cosméticos, hasta venta de cerdos, todo eso para poder sacar adelante a su familia, por quien tiene que ver ya que es madre soltera, tiene a su cargo su hijo de 11 años y su madre una adulta mayor. 
En la comunidad de Talamanca donde las integrantes del grupo viven, no hay fuentes de empleo, por eso es que los créditos de  Fundación Mujer son una gran ayuda para ellas y sus familias, y el sueño de Ingrid es ponerse un bazar en su casa. 
El grupo cuenta con un total de 10 socias, que se dedican a actividades comerciales y agropecuarias y que al igual que Ingrid van a invertir en capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Ingrid is the president of the Women's Communal Bank "Avanzando Juntas" (Advancing Together). She has plenty of experience leading this group. This is the third loan she is requesting from the bank. Ingrid sells all types of merchandise ranging from clothing, shoes, and cosmetics to selling pigs. Everything she does is with the intention of moving her family forward. Ingrid has to oversee everything because she must care for her 11-year-old son and her elderly mother.

The members of this group live in the community of Talamanca, where there are no employment opportunities. For this reason, the loans from Fundación Mujer have been a great help to them and their families. Ingrid's dream is to open a bazaar in her house. The group has a total of 10 members and they engage in retail business activities and farming. Ingrid is involved in these activites and will invest her loan as operating capital.

loans.use: to buy all types of merchandise to sell and farming supplies for growing bananas.

loans.name: 05.01.59 Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lợi has a retail business selling shoes. She is requesting a loan to purchase footwear to resell.

Lợi is 41 years old and she is married with two children. Lợi is the group leader of the 05.01.59 Điện Biên solidarity group, which consists of six members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

In 2011, Lợi joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Lợi has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Lợi has been involved in this business for eight years. The main hardship that Lợi faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Lợi hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find a good job, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase footwear to resell.

loans.name: Mwanaharusi

texts.en:
Mwanaharusi is a married woman with three children, all of whom have finished school. She owns a house which has both piped water and electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past 10 years, she has been selling snacks which include biscuits and popcorn to nearby schoolchildren. She faces a challenge of seasonality as she does not sell when the school closes and children are on holiday. She dreams of establishing a kiosk to sell snacks in the future.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase a fishing net to start a fishing business alongside the selling of snacks. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to uplift her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing net

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her elderly parents). 

Regina has a business selling fruits and vegetables.   She has been in this business for 9 years, and she works 7 days out of every week.  Regina sells her products at the market, wholesale and retail. Regina has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy to buy more watermelons, oranges, passion fruit, and pineapples.

The main business challenges for Regina include the rainy season (because she works in an open place) and thieves.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to sell wholesale only and to build her own house.   Regina lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more watermelons, pineapples, passion fruit and oranges

loans.name: 3.12.127 Tt Vạn Hà Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Cảnh operates a food stall/restaurant selling fruit. She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to resell.

Cảnh is 62 years old and she is married with one child. She is the group leader of the 3.12.127 TT Vạn Hà solidarity group, which consists of five members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

In 2010, Cảnh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Cảnh has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Cảnh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Cảnh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Cảnh hopes for her business to do well, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to resell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has six children, five of whom are in school.  She doesn’t take care of additional family members. 

Jane has a business selling "back cloth" (also called bark cloth). She has been in this business for nine years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Jane sells her products in a shop, retail.  

Jane has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy  more "back cloth". She also generates additional income through selling charcoal.

The main business challenges for Jane include thieves and the transportation of back cloth from villages of Masaka to her place of work. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to sell wholesale only and to venture into selling green bananas. Jane lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her monthly expenses includes feeding the family and medications.

loans.use: To buy more "back cloth" for resale

loans.name: 3.12.128 Tt Vạn Hà Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Xuyên operates a food stall/restaurant selling soup. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make the soup to sell.

Xuyên is 42 years old and she is married with two children. Xuyên is the group leader of the 3.12.128 TT Vạn Hà solidarity group, which consists of seven members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent.

In 2010, Xuyên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Xuyên has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Xuyên has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Xuyên faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Xuyên hopes to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, to buy land of her own, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make soup to sell.

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 5 children, 4 of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (grand children).

Jalia has a business selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for over 10 years and she works 7 days out of every week. Jalia sells her products from home by means of retail. 

Jalia has requested a loan of 800000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal.  The main business challenges for Jalia include seasonality and thieves.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to sell wholesale only and to build rental houses. 

Jalia lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family and school fees.

loans.use: buy charcoal

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth lives in Kongowea, Kenya. She has one child.  Ruth owns a chemist/pharmacy which has been in operation for three years. She learned of Milango from her friends. 

Ruth is applying for a loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings to add new stocks of drugs/medicine. The challenge facing her business is competition from other suppliers and inadequate funds to stock the business.  Despite all these, Ruth would like to open a wholesale trade in the near future.  She believes the additional income from this loan will help improve the standard of living for her family.

loans.use: buy medicine for her pharmacy

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen lives in Kongowea, Kenya. He is a married father of two children who have not yet started schooling.  He plies the trade of selling polythene bags at the Kongowea market.  It is the busiest market in Kenya and has many clients who come to purchase goods.  He sells the bags to customers who use them to carry the items they bought.

Stephen is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase additional stock of polythene bags.   From the additional income, Stephen aspires to open another business to be run by his wife.

loans.use: buy polythene bags

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a computer engineering expert and lives in Mombasa, Kenya. He runs a business selling and repair computers. He started the business from the little capital he had after completing his studies.

Jackson learned of Milango from his friends and joined in order to get capital for business expansion. He is applying for a loan of 100,000 Kenyan  shillings to purchase more computers and computer accessories.  

Jackson will use the additional income from this loan to furnish his house.  He looks forward to trading in bulk upon raising more capital in the future. His main challenges are finding customers and the high cost of computers and accessories.

loans.use: buy computers and computer accessories

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. She has three children and runs a grocery stall which has been operating for the last three years. Nuru borrowed the first capital for the business from her parents.

Upon learning about Milango, Nuru joined her group to access credit/funds for her business.  She is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase more stock for the business and finally employ two more workers.  The main challenges facing her business are some customers not paying on time and the overall inflation.

loans.use: re-stock her grocery store

loans.name: Magsarjav

texts.en: Once again, Magsarjav needs to raise working capital to expand his sales volume. Therefore, the loan he is taking will be dedicated to purchase more spare parts from his supplier.

loans.use: To purchase more spare parts from his supplier for increasing his working capital.

loans.name: Mukadas

texts.ru: Мукадас проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Она разведена. Ей 41 год. У нее трое детей. Она живет вместе с родителями. Мукадас имеет средне - специальное образование. По специальности она медсестра. В этой области она работает 21 год. Кроме того она в месте с родителями арендует помещение на рынке, где открыла небольшую столовую. Она в основном работает поваром. Кредит берет для приобретения необходимых продуктов для приготовления разных видов блюд национальной кухни.
texts.en: Mukadas lives in the J.Rumy district.  She is 41 years old, divorced and has three children.  She lives together with her parents.  Mukadas has a secondary-specialized education.  She is a nurse and has been working in this field for 21 years.  Besides this, she and her parents are leasing a space at a market, where she opened a small cafe.  She primarily works as a chef.  Mukadas is requesting this loan to purchase necessary products for preparing various types of national kitchen dishes.

loans.use: to purchase necessary products

loans.name: Aizada

texts.ru: Айзаде 31 год, замужем, вместе с мужем воспитывает двоих детей, младшей из которых три года. Закончив факультет филологии, Айзада начала работать в школе села Казарман, где и работает по сей день преподавателем. В 2007 году, в поисках дополнительного источника финансирования для своей семьи, Айзада начала заниматься животноводством. Начатое с суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство сегодня приносит около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных продуктов. На сегодняшний день, в ее хозяйстве насчитывается 6 дойных коров, 20 голов овец, 3 лошади.   В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Айзада обратилась в компанию «Бай  Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят. Доходы от кредита Айзада планирует вложить в увеличение поголовья, что позволит ей увеличить свое хозяйство.
texts.en: Aizada is 31 years old, married and is raising two children with her husband, the youngest of whom is three years old.  After graduating with a philology major, Aizada started to work at a school in the Kazarman village, where she works to this day as a teacher.  In 2007, in search of an additional source of financing for her family, she became involved in animal husbandry.  The business, started with a sum of 10,000 som (KGS), currently yields about 5,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk products.  Today, her business has six dairy cows, twenty heads of sheep and thee horses.  In order to further increase livestock headcount, Aizada requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy calves.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into increasing livestock headcount, which would allow her to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Sarina

texts.es:
Sarina ha estado trabajando muy fuerte para satisfacer la demanda y el gusto de sus clientes. 
La señora Sarina, trabaja como farmacéutica en la semana y los fines de semana vende comida en una feria  para mantener a su familia.
 El crédito lo requiere para la construcción de un horno casero para la preparación de la comida y de esta forma obtener mas ingresos.
Ella es casada, tiene un hijo y vive en la casa de su suegra en la zona 16 de Julio ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto.
Es la tercera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y la segunda vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Sarina has been working very hard to satisfy the demand and tastes of her customers.

Sarina works as a pharmacist during the week, and during the week-ends she sells food at a fair in order to support her family.

She needs the loan to build a home-made oven to prepare the food and get more income.

She is married and has one child.  She lives in her mother-in-law’s house in the 16 de Julio zone in the city of El Alto.

This is the third time that she has worked with IMPRO, and it is the second time that she has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to build a home-made clay oven to give her food a special flavor.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe, trabaja vendiendo dulces y refrescos ya que es propietaria de un kiosco.
El crédito lo necesita para la compra de más productos (dulces, galletas) para ponerlos a la venta y de esta forma obtener más ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
Guadalupe es divorciada y tiene cuatro hijos con los cuales vive en la casa de sus padres en la zona Alto Miraflores de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez que trabaja con KIVA.
texts.en:
Guadalupe works selling confectionery and sodas, as she is the proprietor of a kiosk.

She needs the loan to purchase more products (confectionery, cookies) to have them for sale, and in this way to earn more income to support her family.

Guadalupe is divorced and has four sons with whom she lives in her parents' home, in the Alto Miraflores neighborhood of La Paz city.

This is her first time working with IMPRO, and her first time working with Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase confectionery, cookies and other products to sell in her kiosk.

loans.name: 07-Pt2-02-Phú Sơn Group

texts.en:
Hương, a 32-year-old single mother of two, is the group leader of the 07-PT2-02-Phú Sơn solidarity group, which consists of five members. Hương lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, where she has operated a retail business selling food for six years, her main business hardship being a lack of capital.

In 2011, Hương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Having fully repaid two previous loans, she is now requesting a new one to buy candy, sugar, milk, vegetables, shrimp, and fish for resale. With her business profit, Hương hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to buy candy, sugar, milk, vegetables, shrimp, and fish for resale.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.es:
Vladimir es artesano-carpintero; realiza todo tipo de trabajos en madera a pedido de los clientes.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material: madera, pegamento etc., para realizar mas trabajos y tener mayores ingresos para mantener a su familia.
Vladimir, es divorciado y tiene una hija; vive en una casa alquilada la misma se encuentra en la zona de villa Adela en la ciudad de El Alto.
Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO  y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Vladimir is an artisanal carpenter; he does all kind of wood-work that ordered by his customers.

He is requesting the loan for the purchase of materials: wood, glue, etc. to undertake more work and earn greater income to support his family.

Vladimir is divorced and has one daughter. He lives in a rented home in the Villa Adela area in El Alto city.

This is his first time working with IMPRO and his first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase wood, glue, and other supplies for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 6 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (father). 

Margaret has a business selling car scraps.  She has been in this business for 5 years and works 6 days out of every week.  She sells her products from home by means of retail.  She also generates additional income through renting rooms.

Margret has requested a loan of 500000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more car scraps. The main business challenges for Margaret include transportation and thieves.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van to ease transportation and also to build more rental houses.

Margret lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: buy car scraps

loans.name: Evalyne

texts.en:
Evalyne lives in Kongowea, Kenya. She is married and has three school-going children. Evalyne owns a maize sales shop which has been in operation for four years.  The business is situated at the busiest market in Kenya called Kongowea. 

Evalyne learned of Milango from her friends.  After her introduction to Milango, Evalyne is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase more maize for resale.  She believes this loan will go a long way in helping her pay her children’s school fees.  She would like to own a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: buy  maize

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a resident of Kongowea, Kenya. He sells assorted consumer goods and it’s a business he has run for five years. Francis is married and has one school-going child. He was introduced to Milango by his friends and joined in order to access credit. 

Francis is applying for a loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase cosmetics, perfumes and lotions.  Francis also owns a salon and is determined to set up a wholesale business in the future. He believes the additional income from this loan will help him educate his children.

loans.use: buy cosmetics, perfumes and lotions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: re-stock her store

loans.name: Mi Dios Es Mi Fortaleza Group

texts.es: El Banco comunal Mi Dios Es Mi Fortaleza, está conformado por 10 emprendedores que se unieron para  apoyarse y animarse uno a otros  y salir adelante con cada negocio que estos emprendedores poseen. Este Banco Comunal ya han venido trabajando con Fundación León 2000, se les ha brindado financiamiento para invertir en el negocio y aumentar su inventario, estos emprendedores nos expresan que sus clientes están satisfecho por el servicio y el producto que les ofrece. La emprendedora Neuda su negocio al que se dedica es a la venta de artesanía en barro, esta emprendedora está contenta porque sus clientes la visitan más seguido y tiene hasta pedido que tiene que entregar, actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para la compra de pinceles, pintura, jarrones, barro, entre otros para la elaboración de artesanía en barro.
texts.en: The communal bank “Mi Dios Es Mi Fortaleza” [My God is my Strength] is made up of 10 entrepreneurs that came together to support and encourage each other and to help each business owned by the members to get ahead. This communal bank has been working with Fundación León, which has provided them loans to invest in their businesses and increase their inventory. These entrepreneurs have expressed to us that their customers are satisfied with the services and products they offer. The entrepreneur Neuda’s business is selling ceramic craft items. She is happy because her customers come more often and she even has orders to fill. She is currently requesting a loan to buy brushes, paint, vases, and clay, among other things for making ceramic craft items.

loans.use: to buy brushes, paint, vases, and clay, among other things for making ceramic craft items.

loans.name: Elizabeth Carolina

texts.es: El mayor sueño de Elizabeth es desempeñarse como una excelente profesional y obtener ingresos que sean satisfactorios para el desarrollo de mi vida en e futuro. Está estudiando la carrera de Relaciones Internacionales, se encuentra en el último año, y está solicitando el crédito para pagar el curso de finalización de estudios y así poder obtener su título de Licenciada. Ha encontrado algunos desafíos a lo largo de su carrera cono son el tiempo, y las pocas oportunidades para prácticar lo aprendido.
texts.en: Elizabeth's biggest dream is to develop into an excellent professional and obtain income that will be satisfactory for her life in the future. She is studying a major in International Relations and is in the last year. She is asking for the loan to pay for the final course in her studies and thus get her bachelor's degree. She has encountered some challenge along the way of getting her degree like the time, and the lack of opportunities for practicing what she has learned.

loans.use: to pay for her degree

loans.name: Daniel Del Carmen

texts.es: Daniela está estudiando la carrera de Relaciones Internacionales y Comercio Exterior, está en su último años. Y solicita el préstamo para pagar el curso de titulación de sus estudios. Su madre siempre le ha apoyado, y ha hecho muchos sacrificios para que ella pueda estudiar, y está a sólo un paso de poder coronar su carrera. Dentro de algunos años espera ser una profesional y poder superarse en la vida. Espera poder ejercer su profesión en un país extranjero, y hablando varios idioma, ya que sin ello no podría lograrlo.
texts.en: Daniela is studying International Relations and External Commerce, and she is in her last years. She asks for this loan to pay the costs to finish her studies. Her mother has always supported her, and has made many sacrifices so that she could study, and she is only one step away from being able to finish her program. Within a few years she hopes to be a professional and to be able to get ahead in life. She hopes to be able to practice her profession in a foreign country, and speaking various languages, and without her degree will not be able to do so.

loans.use: to pay the costs to finish her studies

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
Lucy es socia del Banco Comunal Proyección, tiene 53 años, se dedica a la venta de pescado, tiene 6 hijos, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 3 años, Lucy es una madre que ha luchado mucho y los préstamos recibidos le han  ayudado mucho para que todos los sueños que tenia se logren, como sacar a sus hijos profesionales, Lucy ha progresado a pesar de las dificultades que tuvo, ahora sus hijos también son empresarios.
El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de pescado.
texts.en: Lucy is a member of the Communal Bank "Proyección" (Projection).  She is 53 years old and works as a fish saleswoman. She has six children and has been a member of Finca for three years. She is a mother who has fought hard and the loans she has received have helped her greatly so that she could accomplish all of the dreams that she had, such as making sure her children are professionals. She has advanced despite the difficulties that she's had and now her children are also businesspeople. With the solicited loan she will invest in the purchase of fish.

loans.use: to purchase fish

loans.name: Maria Lilieth

texts.es: Maria Lilieth es una joven estudiante de la carrera de Licenciatura en Inglés, está cursando su último año y está solicitando el crédito para pagar el curso de finalización de estudios. Dentro de 5 o 10 años se mirá en un aula de clases impartiendo la materia de inglés. Le inspira su mamá porque quiere seguir su ejemplo de ser alguien luchadora en esta viday así podrá tener un mejor futuro.
texts.en: Maria Lilieth is a young student who is pursuing a degree in English.  She is in her final year and is requesting this loan to pay to complete her degree.  Within 5 to 10 years she sees herself in a classroom giving English classes.  Maria Lilieth is inspired by her mom and she wants to follow her example of being a tenacious woman so that she can enjoy a better future.

loans.use: to pay to finish her degree course

loans.name: Ottoniel Alberto

texts.es: Ottoniel estudia la carrera de Ingeniería en Zootecnia. Habita en el municipio de Nueva Guinea. Está solicitando el crédito para compra de una computadora y así poder facilitar los trabajos investigativos que le dejan en la universidad. Se considera una persona que lucha cada día por ser mejor y así poder lograr alcanzar las metas propuestas. Uno de los desafíos que ha encontrado a través de los años de estudios, ha sido la situación económica, pero lo ha podido superar con el apoyo familiar.
texts.en: Ottoniel is studying zootechnics (animal husbandry). He lives in the municipality of Nueva Guinea. He is requesting the loan in order to buy a computer and thus facilitate the research work he is given in the university. He considers himself a person that fights every day to be better and in this way be able to succeed in reaching his goals. One of the challenges that he has faced through the years of study has been the economic situation, but he has been able to overcome it with family support.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Alfarero Group

texts.es:
El grupo Alfarero lo conforman cuatro mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras la coordinadora del grupo es Irene quien vende productos Avon, perfumes, prendas y cosméticos. Ella invertirá el crédito en la compra de mercadería ya que tiene muchos encargos.
Las otras integrantes son Fabiola quien vende esquimo y cerveza, Heydi  quien comercializa ropa y zapato y Emma quien se dedica al comercio de mercadería en general (ropa, cosméticos, perfumes…etc. Lo que este en temporada y le encarguen)
texts.en:
The communal bank "Alfarero" is made up of 4 hardworking and enterprising women.  The coordinator of the group is Irene.  She sells Avon products such as perfumes, garments and cosmetics.  She will use this loan to purchase merchandise, since she has a lot of orders to fill.

The other members of this group are: Fabiola, who sells Eskimo products (ice cream) and beer; Heydi, who sells clothing and shoes; and Emma, who has a business selling general merchandise (clothing, cosmetics, perfumes, etc.) according to the season and the orders she has.

loans.use: to buy underwear, perfume, cosmetics.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es: Elisa es socia del Banco Comunal Muchuy Huaraqac, se dedica a la venta de cereales por mayor y menor, es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 15 años, ella esta muy bien en Finca porque mas que una financiera es como su casa y las socias como sus hermanas, ella agradece a Finca por todo el apoyo que le dieron cuando ella mas necesitaba, todas sus hijas son socias, aprendió mucho con Finca porque le enseñaron a tener una base para poder ser autosuficiente, ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de cereales variados para su negocio.
texts.en: Elisa is a member of the Muchuy Huaragac Communal Bank. She makes a living selling wholesale and retail sale cereal. She has been a member of Finca Perú for 15 years. She's doing well with Finca because more than a financier it's like a home and the other female members are like her sisters. She's thankful to Finca for all the support that they have given her when she's needed it most. All of her daughters are also members and she has learned a lot with Finca because they have taught her to have a base from which to be self sufficient. She will invest the loan in the purchase of various cereals for her business.

loans.use: to purchase various cereals for her business

loans.name: El Huique Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “El Huique” está conformado por 16 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran, almacenes, artesanía, preparación de dulces, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de San Fernando.
Ruperto integrante del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en la segunda fila de pie, en el lugar de en medio. Usa una polera manga corta color verde, además usa bigotes. El se dedica a vender frutas, verduras y abarrotes en un local establecido que tiene ubicado al interior de su casa. Trabaja en este negocio desde hace 20 años junto a su esposa. Todos los días de la semana de 9ºº de la mañana hasta las 11ºº de la noche.
Comenta que la clientela ha ido en aumento con los años.
Su mercadería, específicamente las frutas y verduras las compra en la vega y ferias libres, semanalmente. 
Con el crédito comprará mercadería para su negocio.
Una de las metas para su negocio es incrementar las ventas.
Ruperto vive junto a su esposa y uno de sus sueños a nivel personal es seguir prosperando en su negocio, para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
El está muy agradecido de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio.
Comenta que el grupo del cual forma parte es muy bueno y unido. Respecto a las capacitaciones dice que le han servido para perfeccionarse en sus conocimientos, a pesar de la experiencia comercial.
San Fernando es una ciudad ubicada en la región del Libertador General Bernardo O´Higgins , zona centro de Chile. La actividad económica de la ciudad se basa principalmente en la agricultura (viñedos, cultivo de remolacha, frutales, tabaco, trigo y cultivo tradicional), la agroindustria (empresas exportadoras de frutas, conserveras, de lácteos, etc.) y el comercio.
texts.en:
The communal bank 'El Huique' is formed of 16 entrepreneurs who work in a variety of different fields, including grocery stores, handicrafts and candy makers, among others. They are all from the city of San Fernando.

Rupert is a member of the communal bank; he appears in the photo standing up in the middle of the second row wearing a green, short-sleeved polo shirt and he has a mustache. He works selling fruit, vegetables and other groceries from premises located inside his house. He has worked in this business along with his wife for 20 years, every day of the week from 9am to 11pm. He tells us that his customer base has grown over the years. He will use the loan to stock up his shop. One of his business goals is to increase sales.

Rupert lives together with his wife, and one of their personal dreams is for their business to continue prospering, so that they can give their family a better quality of life.

He is very grateful for the opportunity provided by the Fondo Esperanza (the Hope Fund) as it allows him to invest in his business. He says that the group of which he is part is very good and its members are very close. With regards to training, he says that it has made him able to perfect his knowledge, despite his commercial experience.

The city of San Fernando is located in the Libertador General Bernardo O'Higgins region in central Chile. The economic activity of the city is based mainly on agriculture (vineyards, orchards and the cultivation of beetroot, tobacco, wheat and traditional crops), plus agro-industries (companies who export fruit, canned food, dairy products) and commerce.

loans.use: To buy stock for his shop.

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es: Don Gustavo de 61 años de edad es casado, sus hijos ya son mayores y trabajan y le apoyan en lo que pueden.  Gustavo trabaja como guarda de seguridad en un hospital, donde hace turnos de 12 horas. Esta solicitando su credito con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda reparando el techo y las paredes que estan en mal estado, ademas si el dinero lo permite desea hacer una division en la parte de la cocina.  Cabe señalar que don Gustavo es una persona con muchos deseos de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia pues todos los financiamientos recibidos en esta institucion son para ir mejorando poco a poco su casita.
texts.en: Don Gustavo is 61 years old and married.  His children are already grown, working, and support him whenever they can.  Gustavo works as a security guard in a hospital, where he works 12-hour shifts.  He is requesting his fourth loan with the intention of improving his home by repairing the roof and the walls that are in bad condition.  In addition, the money will enable him to put up a dividing wall in part of the kitchen.  It should be noted that Don Gustavo is a person who greatly desires to improve his family's living conditions.  All of the loans he has received from AFODENIC have been used to improve his small house a little bit at a time.

loans.use: to repair the roof and walls of his house.

loans.name: Dolores Guillerma

texts.es: Dolores es un mujer de 33 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su bazar su historia empezó hace un año comenzó con prendas de vestir y luego con otros artículos de bazar, su trabajo abre desde 7:00 hasta las 21:00, si tiene dificultades son la competencia y la delincuencia, está soltera, no tiene hijos, su sueño más importante es terminar de hacer la casa y tener un negocio más grande. Por  eso quiere el préstamo para su bazar y asi comprar papeleria, cuadernos ect.
texts.en:
Dolores is a 33-year-old woman who has many aspirations for the coming years for growing her stationery store.  Her story began a year ago when she started with clothing items, later adding other types of stationery items.  Her work starts at 7 a.m. and goes through 9 p.m.

Her difficulties are the competition and crime.  She is single, without children, and her most important dream is to finish building her home and to have a larger business.  For this reason, she wants the loan for her stationery store, as she will buy stationery, notebooks, etc.

loans.use: to purchase stationery, notebooks, etc.

loans.name: Jose Miguel

texts.es:
Jose Miguel tiene 65 años, vive en Sinabamba perteneciente a Chimbo Provincia de Bolivar,es casado tiene 4 hijos, vive con la esposa y 2 nietos. 

La ventanilla SINABAMBA esta ubicada en La Parroquia La Magdalena perteneciente al Canton Chimbo queda a 15 minutos de la oficina, esta ventanilla se dedica a la labores de a la agricultura como siembra de maiz.

Jose se dedica a la siembra de maiz en terrenos propios, el dinero lo va a invertir en la coprar de abonos urea y semilla para la siembra.

Comprar sus productos en Comercial Prado y los vende en la Feria de Chimbo los Sabados, su sueño es comprar mas terreno y tenber dinero para la comida diaria, ha enfrendado desafios como las enfermedades del cultivos.

Le gusta trabajar e ir a misa los domingos.
texts.en:
Jose Miguel is 65 years old, and lives in Sinabamba, which is part of Chimbo, in the province of Bolivar.  He is married with four children, and lives with his wife and two grandchildren.

The SINABAMBA communal bank is located in the parish of La Magdalena, which is in Chimbo Canton, 15 minutes away from the main office.  The members of this communal bank work in agricultural work such as growing corn.

Jose works growing corn on his own land.  He will invest the money in purchasing manure, urea, and seeds for sowing.

He purchases his products at the Prado commercial center, and sells them on Saturdays at the Chimbo market.  His dream is to purchase more land, and to have money to cover his daily food needs.  He has faced challenges such as crop diseases.

He enjoys working and going to Mass on Sundays.

loans.use: to invest in purchasing manure, urea, and seeds for sowing.

loans.name: Narcisa De Jesus

texts.es: Narcisa es un mujer de 37 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su bazar su historia empezó en la calle con manicure y pedicure, su trabajo lo hace sola, no tiene dificultades, está soltera, si tiene hijos son adultos, su sueño más importante es desear que su negocio crezca y surtirlo, para sus hijos desea que estudien y salgan adelante. Por  eso quiere el préstamo para su bazar y asi comprar papaleria, cuadernos, plumas.
texts.en:
Narcisa is a 37-year-old woman, who has great aspirations for the coming years for growing her stationery store.  Her story began providing manicures and pedicures on the streets.  She works on her own, and faces no difficulties.  She is single, with grown children.

Her most important dream is that she wants her business to grow and to stock it well, as she wants her children to study and moved ahead in life.  For this reason, she wants the loan for her stationery store, so that she can purchase stationery, notebooks, and pens.

loans.use: to purchase stationery, notebooks, and pens.

loans.name: Mohamed's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you this group of primary school teachers from Koidu in Eastern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of SLL 9,000,000 from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to solve their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, they repay the loan using their monthly salaries. Their bursar is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

Mohamed is the leader of this group of teachers. The 40-year-old is a native of Kpowubu village in Eastern Sierra Leone. He is married to a teacher and the couple have four children who are attending primary and tertiary institutions. Mohamed has served in the teaching profession for seven years now. 

He is requesting this loan in order to pay school fees for his children and will use the rest to buy house-building materials like nails and cement.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children and use the rest to buy house-building materials like nails and cement.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married with one adult son. She runs a small farm growing vegetables in greenhouses. Svetlana has been in this business 11 years. Her experience helps her to have good crops and sell the produce at a good price. Svetlana is a hardworking and enthusiastic person. She would like to develop her business further.

Svetlana is asking for a loan of 12,000 UAH. She is going to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and film (plastic) for three greenhouses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and film (plastic) for greenhouses

loans.name: Karin Yunek

texts.es: Karin es un mujer de 37 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su tienda su historia empezó desde que ella vivió desde el cantón santa Elena a Leónidas proaño con el préstamo del bono inicio su tienda el conjugue se fue lejos con mucho sacrificio ha salido adelante su tienda, su trabajo lo hace con una hija y el horario es de 7:00 hasta las 21:00, si tiene dificultades son la competencia y la delincuencia, está soltera, si tiene1 hija estudia en escuela fiscal, su sueño más importante es tener mi tienda más grande ya como una despensa y mi hija en la universidad. Por  eso quiere el préstamo para su tienda y comprar arroz, bebeidas, confites, dulces.
texts.en:
Karin, 37, is a woman who has a lot of aspirations to prosper in her store in the coming years.  Her story started when she lived in the Leónidas Proaño area in the San Elena canton.  She started her store with the loan.  Her husband went far away.  With a lot of sacrifice she has gotten ahead in her store.

She works with her daughter.  Her schedule is from 7:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m.  Yes, she has difficulties, which are the competition and the delinquency.

She is single, and she has one daughter who goes to public school.  Her most important dream is to have a larger store like a general pantry and for her daughter to go to the university.  That is why she wants the loan to buy rice, drinks, candy, and sweets for her store.

loans.use: to buy rice, drinks, candy, and sweets.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita, 47, resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Henry, an overseas contract worker, and mother to her five children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Teresita operates a buy-and-sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and sell it for a little profit. Her products are men's and women's clothes and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy RTW (ready-to-wear) products and merchandise items to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Teresita hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of merchandise and items needed in her business

loans.name: Yeny

texts.es:
La socia Yeny pertenece al banco comunal “IMASUMAC II” y vive en la ciudad del Cusco y donde también realiza sus actividades económicas. 

La socia Yeny sigue ejerciendo su profesión de enfermera pero tiene un negocio complementario que consiste en la venta de CD y otras cosas más.
