Con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener beneficios como por ejemplo incrementar el capital del negocio y con las ganancias puede dar una mejor calidad de vida a su hija. En esta oportunidad Yeny requiere el préstamo para comprar más CDs. 

La socia Yeny agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en: The communal bank member Yeny belongs to the "IMASUMAC II" group and lives in the city of Cusco where she also accomplishes her economic activities.  Yeny continues working as a nurse but she has an additional business that consists of celling cd's and other items.  With her previous credit things went well and she was able to obtain benefits like for example increasing the capital of her business and with her earnings she is able to give a better quality of life to her daughter.  At this time Yeny needs a loan in order to purchase more CD's.  Yeny is thankful for the support that she has received and she likewise promises to follow-through in a disciplined manner with the repayments of her loans.

loans.use: to purchase more CD's

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
This is Carmelita, 48, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Felix, a driver, and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  
                           
Carmelita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns revenue by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 11,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Carmelita hopes to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Roberto Fernando

texts.es:
Roberto Fernando tiene 33  años es soltero, vive con los abuelos. Vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

La Ventanilla EL SAGRADO CORAZON, esta ventanilla se encuentra ubicada en el sector de las calles Ernesto Briones y Parroquia 10 de Noviembre, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica al Comercio.

El señor Roberto Fernando se dedica al trabajo de Ebanista, es decir a la confección de muebles de madera.El dinero lo es para la comprar de madera, clavos y tapis para los muebles

Las compras de los insumos las realiza en la ciudad de Ventas donde el Señor Juan Arevalo. El crédito les ayudado a aumentar la producción y tener productos de calidad, el sueño de Roberto es tener un negocio más grande, ha enfrentado desafíos como los precios altos de madera que es la materia prima.
En los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Roberto Fernando is 33 years old, is single, and lives with his grandparents.  He lives in Cantón Ventanas in the Province of Los Ríos.  His communal bank is called "El sagrado corazón" and it is located in the sector of the streets Ernesto Briones and Parroquia 10 of November.  It is in the city of Cantón Ventanas, and the bank is dedicated to business.

Roberto Fernando works as a cabinetmaker, which is to say that he works making furniture out of wood.  The loan he is requesting is for the purchase of wood, nails, and coverings for the furniture.  

Roberto makes his grocery purchases in the city of Ventas at the store of Mr. Juan Arevalo.  The credit that Roberto requests will help him to increase production and to have quality products.  His dream is to have a larger business.  He has had to face challenges like the high price of wood which is his raw material.   

In his free time he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to purchase wood, nails, and coverings for furniture.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
This is Nelly, 59, resident of Manila, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother to her three children. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Nelly operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Nelly hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
This is Susan, 58, resident of Manila, Philippines. Single, she manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses 

Susan operates a fruit stand. She buys seasonal fruits that are native to the Philippines like bananas, which are grown mostly in the south region of Luzon. She also sells other Filipino fruit staples. Aside from this she also cooks and caters food for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of fruit to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Susan dreams to be able to grow her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of fruit needed in her business

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en: Vanna, 42, is widowed and resides with her father and one child in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She and her child are employed in rubber plantation. They earn USD 8 per day, approximately. In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Vanna is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase rubber plant seeds and fertilizer for growing rubber plants to sell. By doing so, she would be able to generate extra income to support the family. In the future, she would like to use further profit to expand her agricultural business

loans.use: to purchase rubber plant seeds and fertilizer for growing rubber plants to sell

loans.name: Virgen Natividad De Chuso Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Virgen Natividad De Chuso” es un banco comunal que pertenece a la Asociación Arariwa y está conformado por 7 mujeres y 4 varones. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días y todas las socias tienen que estar presentes en las reuniones programadas sino pagan una multa. La mayoría de los socios son vecinos y tienen una buena amistad y viven en la comunidad de Chuso del distrito de Chichero de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento  del Cusco. Nuestros socios son gente muy trabajadora y muy ingeniosa, ellos se dedican principalmente a la ganadería y agricultura, ellos cuentan con bastos terrenos y venden lo que sus tierras producen, según las fechas de siembra y cosecha, ellos cuando no están en sus tierras se dedican al comercio, comprando y almacenando víveres para su futura venta. Los socios solicitan el préstamo para así seguir reinvirtiendo en sus diferentes actividades. Nuestros socios agradecen y valoran el préstamo otorgado ya que en la comunidad de Chuso ellos solo tienen este apoyo financiero.

La socia Vilma tiene 33 años edad y nació en el distrito de Chinchero y vive en la comunidad de Chuso, ella no vive con su pareja pero es padre y madre para cuatro hijos, ella es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a sus hijos pues se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, ella también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y gallinas. En esta oportunidad la socia Vilma requiere el préstamo para comprar más animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes.
texts.en:
The Virgen Natividad de Chuso communal bank is part of Asociación Arariwa and is made up of seven women and four men.  The meetings of the communal bank are every month and all the members have to be present at the scheduled meetings; if not, they pay a fine.  The majority of the members are neighbors and good friends, and live in the community of Chuso in the district of Chichero in the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.

Our members are very hardworking and very clever.  They work primarily in livestock and agriculture.  They have vast plots of land and sell what their lands produce, depending on the planting and harvest dates.  When they are not on their land they work in trade, buying and storing supplies for future sale.  The members are requesting the loan to continue reinvesting in their different jobs.  Our members are grateful for and value the loan granted because in the community of Chuso they have only this financial support.

The member Vilma, 33, was born in the district of Chinchero and lives in the community of Chuso.  She does not live with her partner, but is father and mother to four children.  She is a hardworking and enterprising woman who gets her children ahead because she works in agriculture and livestock.  She also works raising small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens.

Currently Vilma needs the loan to buy more small animals such as guinea pigs.

loans.use: to buy more small animals such as guinea pigs.

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Zoila, es una madre de familia de 39 años de edad, es madre soltera con una hija, vive en la casa de sus padres la cual esta ubicada en el Pueblo Joven “Santo Domingo” a 3 minutos de la Provincia de Lambayeque, el mismo que se encuentra a unos 10 minutos de la Ciudad de Chiclayo.

Zoila de dedica exclusivamente a dar servicio de costura a todos los moradores de la zona en la que vive, tiene muchos conocimientos sobre el mismo, siempre tiene pedidos de blusas, pantalones, vestidos entre otros, para lo que cuenta con sus maquinas propias entre ellas una es artesanal y la otra es una remalladora

Esta solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 2000 Nuevos Soles los cuales los destinará para la compra de telas y otros materiales de costura, debido a que tiene pedidos de uniformes escolares y es por que la campaña escolar esta cerca y quiere ir ya cumpliendo con sus clientes, de esa manera ella podrá generarse otros ingresos con los cuales buscará mejores oportunidades educativas para su menor hija.

Pues se sabe que es una mujer responsable por lo que ha sido cliente nuestro y ha demostrados responsabilidad con sus pago.
texts.en:
Zoila is the 39-year-old mother of a family. She is a single mother with one daughter. She lives in her parents' house, which is located in the young town of Santo Domingo, three minutes from the province of Lambayeque, which is about 10 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Zoila works exclusively in providing sewing services to all the residents of the zone where she lives. She has a lot of knowledge about this, and she always has orders for blouses, pants, and dresses, among other items, for which she has her own machines. Among them, one is an artisan machine and one is an overlock.

She is applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan in the amount of 2000 PEN, which will be used to purchase fabrics and other sewing items, since she has orders for school uniforms and the school season is near, and she wants to fill her customers' orders. In this way she will be able to generate other income with which she will look for better educational opportunities for her young daughter.

It is known that she is a responsible woman because she has been our client and has demonstrated responsibility with her payments.

loans.use: to buy fabric and be able to complete her orders.

loans.name: Boldsaikhan

texts.en:
Mr. Boldsaikhan, 30, is a civil servant and lives with his wife and his two daughters in a rental apartment that is in Darkhan, the second-largest city in Mongolia. He has been doing his job for a decade nonstop. One of his biggest wishes is to have his own apartment that is convenient to live in with his family. 

Recently, his management campaigned to support their employees to pay for the cost of purchasing a new apartment in the city in part, for the most part of the apartment cost is paid by the state. It is a vital and amazing event to them and their families. Now he needs to pay the remaining part soon. The loan he is taking will be dedicated to cover some costs of his purchasing a new apartment.

loans.use: To cover some costs of purchasing a new apartment.

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.es:
Elisabeth nació en la ciudad de Coya (Calca, Perú) y tiene 28 años de edad. Ella tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una hija (Luz Diana de 11 años de edad). Actualmente, ella vive en la ciudad de Pisaq y donde realiza sus actividades. Ella se dedica a la venta de artesanía. Ella vende collares, mantas, mochilas, pulseras, agua mineral y otras cosas más. Su esposo Arístides se encarga de la elaboración de artesanía. Ya son 8 años que se dedican a este negocio y les va muy bien gracias al empeño que ponen en su trabajo. Elisabeth requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo mantas, collares, sombreros, ponchos, guantes y otras cosas más. 

Los socios del Banco Comunal “Mosoq Ñusta” se reúne cada treinta en el distrito de Pisaq de la provincia de Calca (Cusco, Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Elisabeth was born in the city of Coya (Calca, Peru) and is 28 years old.  She is in a common-law relationship from which she has one daughter (Luz Diana, 11 years old).  Currently she lives in the city of Pisaq where she works.

She works selling handicrafts and has a sales stall in the arts and crafts market in the city of Pisaq.  She sells necklaces, blankets, backpacks, bracelets, mineral water, and other things.  Her husband Arístides takes care of making the handicrafts.  They have had this business for eight years already and it is going very well for them thanks to the effort they put into their work.

Elisabeth needs the loan to buy merchandise such as, for example, blankets, necklaces, hats, ponchos, gloves, and other things.

The members of Mosoq Ñusta Communal Bank meet every month in the district of Pisaq in the province of Calca (Cusco, Peru). Cusco is known for being a very touristy and commercial area, for its traditional Inti Raymi festival, and because one of the seven wonders of the world is there, Machu Picchu.

loans.use:
to buy merchandise such as blankets, 
necklaces, hats, ponchos, gloves, and other things.

loans.name: Yrene

texts.es:
Irene nació en la comunidad de Amaru de la ciudad de Pisaq (Perú) y tiene 36 años de edad. Ella tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos. Actualmente, ella vive en la ciudad de Pisaq y donde realiza sus actividades, ella se dedica a la elaboración de artesanía de tipo cerámica, ella compra artesanía de tipo cerámica sin pintar pues su labor de la socia es darle color y brillo. Ella también vende sus productos en la ciudad de Pisaq y pertenece a una asociación de artesanos. Ya son 5 años que se dedica a la artesanía y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Irene requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como pintura, laca, barniz, arcilla y otras cosas más.

Los socios del Banco Comunal “Mosoq Ñusta” se reúne cada treinta en el distrito de Pisaq de la provincia de Calca (Cusco, Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Irene was born in the community of Amaru in the city of Pisaq (Peru) and is 36 years old.  She has a common-law relationship from which she has five children.  Currently she lives in the city of Pisaq where she works.

She works making ceramic handicrafts.  She buys unpainted ceramic handicrafts and her job is to give them color and shine.  She also sells her products in the arts and crafts market in the city of Pisaq, and she belongs to the artisans' association.  She has been working in handicrafts for five years now and it is going very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her job.

Irene needs the loan to buy materials such as paint, lacquer, varnish, clay, and other things.

The members of Mosoq Ñusta Communal Bank meet every month in the district of Pisaq in the province of Calca (Cusco, Peru). Cusco is known for being a very touristy and commercial area, for its traditional Inti Raymi festival, and because one of the seven wonders of the world is there, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to buy materials such as paint, lacquer, varnish, clay, and other things.

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: Monsieur  Ibrahima est  un des vigiles  des guichets de l’IMF. Il est  mariée et père de famille. Il a recouru  aux préteurs pour  faire  fasse aux frais de scolarité de son fils ainé qui est en deuxième année de formation professionnel en mécanique. Il faut dire que c’est un investissement pour lui de bien suivre l’éducation de ses enfants  pour que dans l’avenir  ils puissent  le relever  par rapport aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en: Mr. Ibrahima is one of the night watchmen of the branch offices of this microfinance institution. He is married and a father. He has turned toward lenders to cope with the schooling costs for his eldest son, who is in his second year of professional training to be a mechanic. It must be said that this is an investment for him to pursue his children's education, so that they may help him in turn when it comes to day-to-day family expenses.

loans.use: to cover the cost of schooling for his son training to be a mechanic

loans.name: Ermek

texts.ru: Эрмек 46 лет, замужем, воспитывает четверых детей. Закончив факультет филологии, Эрмек начала работать в школе села Восьмое марта, где и работает по сей день преподавателем кыргызского языка. В 1990 году, в поисках дополнительного источника финансирования для своей семьи, Эрмек начала заниматься животноводством. Начатое с покупки коров хозяйство сегодня приносит около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Эрмек обратилась в компанию «Бай  Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец и кормов. Доходы от кредита Эрмек планирует вложить в увеличение поголовья, что позволит ей увеличить свое хозяйство.
texts.en: Ermek is 46 years old, married and raising four children. After graduating with a philology major, Ermek started to work at a school in the 8-March village, where she works to this day as a Kyrgyz-language teacher. In 1990, in search of an additional source of financing for her family, she became involved in animal husbandry. The business, started with a purchase of cows, currently yields about 15,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk products.  In order to further increase livestock headcount, Ermek requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy sheep and livestock feed. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into increasing livestock headcount, which would allow her to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and feed

loans.name: Dolores Maria

texts.es: Dolores es un mujer de 44 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su taller de costura su historia empezó hace 10 años cuando dejo su actividad, su trabajo lo hace sola, si tiene dificultades, está soltera, si tiene2 hijos, su sueño más importante es prosperar en su taller de costura. Por  eso quiere el préstamo para su taller de costura para comprar maquina de costura, telas, herramientas.
texts.en: Dolores is a 44 year-old woman who hopes to see her sewing workshop prosper in the coming years.  Her story began 10 years ago when she left her former work.  In her business she works alone.  She faces some difficulties, as she is single and has 2 children.  Her main dream is to see her sewing workshop prosper.  For this reason, she wants a loan for her sewing workshop, so that she can buy a sewing machine, fabric and other tools.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, fabric and other dressmaking tools

loans.name: Seang

texts.en:
Seang is a 46-year-old, married woman residing with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia.

For over four years, she has been involved in the agriculture business. Specifically, she grows potatoes and earns approximately $5 per day. Her husband is employed at a rubber plantation and earns approximately $3 per day. One of her children is a tailor earning approximately $3 per day.

Seang would like to rebuild her current house. With this goal in mind, Seang is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase construction materials to enlarge and strengthen her house and to thereby provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to run a sewing shop at home and to help her children receive bachelor degrees.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to enlarge and strengthen her house

loans.name: Chan Khan

texts.en:
Chan Khan is a 26-year-old, married woman residing with her husband and two children in Battambang Province, Cambodia.

For over two years, she has been selling vegetables and groceries, which allows her to earn approximately $15 per day. Her husband is a construction foreman earning approximately $10 per day.

Due to the difficulties her family experiences in getting around, Chan Khan is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use money saved on transportation expenses to better support her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business, rebuild her house, and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Nemelyn

texts.en: Nemelyn is applying for a new loan of Php 13,000 to stock her variety store. The loan that she previously took from NWTF and KIVA continues to provide her and her family the opportunity to increase their income and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en: Analyn is borrowing Php 20,000 to fund her hog business. The loan that she previously took for this business through KIVA and NWTF continues to provide Analyn and her family income to expand her agricultural business operations.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and feed.

loans.name: Lorelie

texts.en:
Lorelie is 35 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a soft drink distribution business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock.

Lorelie has borrowed and repaid nine previous loans from NWTF. She has been running her business for six years and earns additional income from a housing rental.

Lorelie aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Emma is 42 years old and has two children who are in school.

Emma buys and sells vegetables in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

Emma has been in this business for three years. In the future, Emma would like to save enough money to send her two children in college.

loans.use: To purchase additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 49 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Susan runs a sari sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Susan has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, milk, creamer, noodles, and canned goods.

In the future, Susan would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Agrepina

texts.es:
Agrepina nació en la comunidad de Amaru del distrito Pisaq (Cusco, Perú) y tiene 43 años de edad, ella tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene siete hijos. Actualmente, ella vive en la ciudad de Pisaq y donde realiza sus actividades, ella se dedica a  la venta de comida de forma ambulatoria en una plaza. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Agrepina requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, carne, fideos y otras cosas más.  

los socios del Banco Comunal “Mosoq Ñusta” se reúne cada treinta en el distrito de Pisaq de la provincia de Calca (Cusco, Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Agrepina was born in the Amaru community in the district of Pisaq (Cusco, Peru). She is 43 years old. She is in a common-law marriage, from which she has seven children. Currently, she lives in the city of Pisaq, where she does her work. She sells food as a street vendor in the main square. She has done this for many years already, and it is going very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her job. 

Agrepina needs the loan to buy more supplies such as rice, sugar, meat, beans, and other items.

The members of the "Mosoq Ñusta" communal bank meet every month in the district of Pisaq in Calca province (Cusco, Peru). Cusco is known for being a very commercial and tourist area, for its traditional Inti Raymi festival, and because one of the seven wonders of the world, Machupicchu, is there.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies such as rice, sugar, meat, beans, and other items

loans.name: Aparicio Santiago

texts.es: El socio  el Sr. Aparicio Santiago; continua teniendo su estudio jurídico, y ahora el desea terminar de pagar los ultimos años de estudio de sus hijos en las carreras de economia y de derecho. El socio solicita el préstamo para pagar los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en: Our member, Sr. Aparicio Santiago, is an attorney and has his own law practice.  He is applying for a loan to pay college expenses for his two children, one of whom is studying economics and the other law.

loans.use: to pay his children's college expenses.

loans.name: Lucia Santuza

texts.es:
Lucia es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de nazca, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima cálido y sobre todo por sus gente muy generosa y acogedora, es madre de 4 hijos cuyas edades comprenden 20,16,15 y 10 años, a los cuales ama muchísimo y son su razón para vivir y salir adelante cada día, como buena peruana le gusta mucho nuestra comida, por ello uno de los platos favoritos de lucia es el riquísimo Trigo con Bisteck, debido a que sus padre no tenían los medios económicos suficientes ella solo estudio hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Administración.

Con mucho esfuerzo y ahorro lucia pudo iniciar su negocio de venta de zapatos y accesorios, se dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas diarias, ella es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo respetuosa y honrada por ello ella cree que le va bien en su negocio ya que los clientes siempre regresan a comprarle sus productos.

Lucia está muy agradecida con los prestatarios kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mas mercadería en especial zapatos de temporada escolar para su negocio y con ello podrá tener más variedad de productos para ofrecer y tendrá mayores ingresos, así podrá seguir trabajando y luchando para cumplir su mas grande sueño:” Tener una tienda mas grande”
texts.en:
Lucia is a very hardworking woman.  She lives in the city of Nazca, which is known for its hot climate and above all for its extremely generous and welcoming people.  She is the mother of four children, who are 20, 16, 15, and 10 years old and whom she loves very much.  They are her reason for living and getting ahead every day.  Like all good Peruvians, she loves Peruvian cuisine, and one of Lucia's favorite dishes is the delicious trigo con bistec.  She only studied up until the fifth grade because her parents didn't have enough money, but she would have liked to have studied management.

After much effort and saving, Lucia was able to start her business selling shoes and accessories.  She spends about 10 hours a day at her business.  She is very friendly to her customers and above all she is respectful and honest, which is why she thinks her business is going well.  Her customers always come back to buy from her.

Lucia is very thankful to Kiva's lenders, as it is because of their help that she will be able to buy more merchandise for her business.  With that, she will be able to have a wider variety of products to offer and she will earn more, which will allow her to keep working and striving to achieve her greatest dream: to have a bigger store.

loans.use: to purchase school shoes

loans.name: Estefany

texts.es:
Estefany es una joven de 22 años, vive junto a su esposo y juntos tienen un hijo de al cual ama muchísimo y es su razón de vivir, ella vive en la ciudad de Imperial, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima cálido, su agricultura y en especial por la generosidad de sus pobladores. 

Estefany trabaja en el campo y su esposo en obras de construcción y así como también conduciendo una mototaxi, el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al dia y puede atender hasta 15 clientes en el dia, siempre tiene una buena actitud con los demas por eso ella cree que le va bien a su esposo en su negocio porque es muy trabajador y respetuoso y porque su hijo es el motor que ellos tienen para salir adelante.

Estefany está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo brindado ella podrá comprar una mototaxi para que su esposo pueda seguir trabajando, con esta mejora ya no tendrán que pagar alquiler y asi podrán tener mayores ingresos y seguir trabajando para poder cumplir su mas grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia y darle una profesión a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Estefany is a 22-year-old youth. She lives with her husband, and together they have a son whom she loves a lot, and he is her reason for living. She lives in the city of Imperial, a city characterized by its warm climate, agriculture and especially by the generosity of its inhabitants.
Estefany works in the field and her husband in construction and also driving a rickshaw. He works about 10 hours a day and can serve up to 15 customers a day. He always has a good attitude with others, which is why she believes that things are going well for her husband in his business - because he is a hard worker and very respectful, and also because their kids are the motor that they have to get ahead. 
Estefany is very grateful to Kiva lenders since, thanks to the support they are providing, she will be able to buy a rickshaw so that her husband can continue working. With this improvement, they will no longer have to pay rent and in this way will have greater income and will continue working to achieve their biggest dream: “to have their own home and to give their son a profession.”

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw.

loans.name: Aristides

texts.es:
El socio   Aristides sigue pertenece al banco comunal “IMASUMAC II” y continua viviendo en la ciudad del Cusco y donde también realiza sus actividades económicas. 

El socio Aristides sigue dedicándose a la producción y venta de artesanía. Con el anterior préstamo Aristides pudo incrementar el capital del negocio y obtuvo buenos beneficios y pudo comprar mas mercadería. En esta oportunidad Aristides requiere el préstamo para comprar artesanía como por ejemplo ceramica y tambien va comprar materiales como por ejemplo pintura y esmaltes. 

La socia Aristides agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Aristides continues belonging to “IMASUMAC II” Communal Bank and continues living in the city of Cusco where he engages in his economic activities.

He continues making and selling handicrafts. With the previous loan Aristides was able to increase his working capital and he earned good profits by buying more merchandise. At this time, Aristides needs the loan to buy crafts such as ceramics and he is also going to buy paint and enamels. 

He is grateful for the support being provided him and is committed to making his payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as paint and enamels

loans.name: Dios Es Amor Group

texts.es:
La señora Lucia es integrante de la Alcancía Comunal “Dios e Amor”, este grupo está conformado por 07 personas que se dedican a distintas actividades comerciales. Lucía tiene 54 años y tiene 09 hijos, 02 de los cuales aun son dependientes. Hace más de 20 años que la señora Lucía se dedica a la venta ambulatoria de frutas, confiterías y bebidas; siendo la mayor parte de sus clientes personas que viajan al centro del país. Ella se siente orgullosa, pues con su esfuerzo ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos. Ella se ha trazado como meta implementar una bodega; pues de esta manera incrementará sus ingresos económicos y su calidad de vida. En esta oportunidad solicita el préstamo para la compra de gaseosas, agua mineral y diversa variedad de fruta que serán ofrecidas a sus clientes. La Alcancía “Dios es Amor” está agradecida con el crédito porque hace posible su progreso.
La señora Lucía es la que viste chompa negra y chaleco verde. En la parte inferior están las fotografías de las señoras Yrene y Leidi.
texts.en: Lucia is a member of the communal bank "God is Love" group that is made up of 7 responsible people who do different commercial activities for a living. Lucia is 54 years old and is separated with 9 children, 2 of which are still dependents. It was more than 20 years ago that Lucia began the ambulatory selling of fruit, candy and beverages, the majority of her clients being people that travel to the center of the country. She is proud of her strength to be able to progress her children alone, as she is a single mother. The money that she receives is of much help for her since it allows her to continue supporting her children. Lucia has a goal to install a grocery store since this assures her that she will have greater income. In this opportunity, she is requesting the loan to purchase soda, mineral water, and fruit to offer to her clients. The communal bank "God is Love" is grateful for the loan since it makes their progress possible. Lucia is the one that you see in the black sweater and green vest. At the bottom are Leidi and Yrene's photographs.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, mineral water and fruit.

loans.name: Lideres Del Tercer Milenio Group

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal LIDERES DEL TERCER MILENIO; este banco está situado en el distrito de  Wanchaq en la provincia  de Cusco departamento de Cusco.
El socio Genaro tiene 40 años es casado y tiene 3 hijos; el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de libros el socio viaja hasta la ciudad de Lima y Arequipa para comprar su mercadería para luego distribuirlo a sus clientes que  el solicitan como por ejemplo : librerías, él socio a la vez cuenta con un carrito que lo  alquila brindando el servicio interprovincial todos los días, él socio es una persona bien alegre y responsable con muchas ganas de salir adelante por su familia.

El socio solicita el prestamo para aumentar mas mercaderia para su negocio de libros.

Los otros socios se dedican a la compra y venta de fotocopiadoras, venta de libros, transporte turístico, venta de periódicos.

El socio agradece este medio por el cual le facilita el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
(los socios que aparecen en la parte superior de la fotografia son socios que pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo ).
texts.en:
The LIDERES DEL TERCER MILENIO Communal Bank is located in the Wanchaq district in the province of Cusco, department of Cusco.
Genaro is 40, married, and has three children. He alternates his daily chores with his business buying and selling books. He travels to the cities of Lima and Arequipa to buy merchandise to later sell to his customers, such as bookstores. He also has a little car with which he provides inter-provincial transportation every day. He is a very happy and responsible person, with a great desire to get ahead for the sake of his family.
He is requesting this loan to increase his stock of books to sell.
The other members buy and sell photocopiers, sell books, provide transportation for tourists, and sell newspapers.
Genaro is grateful to be able to get his loan this way and promises to repay his quotas. The members at the top of the photo are those who were unable to attend for work reasons.

loans.use: to increase his stock of merchandise for his book business.

loans.name: Tserenbat

texts.en:
Mr. Tserenbat, 30, is a taxi driver, and he has been running his business nonstop since 2008. 

Now, he lives with his parents in the Ger district, a Mongolian traditional nomadic tent district, which is in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Still, he runs a taxi with his old, used car. Lately it has been damaged and is becoming old completely, especially its core part, a gear box, which has an issue that must be resolved to work normally. It will have a faulty influence, as he said. Therefore, he decided to renovate his car to further run his business normally. He is requesting a loan to purchase the spare parts for his old car.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his old car.

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en:
Sarin is a 45-year-old, married man residing with his wife and three children in Battambang Province, Cambodia.

For over ten years, he and his wife have been involved in the agriculture business. They have extensive experience in this industry sector, and they have been successful thus far in their careers. Specifically, they grow rice and raise cattle. On average, they earn approximately $8 per day. Sarin also works as a construction worker, allowing him to earn approximately $4 per day of additional income to better support the family.

In order to expand his family’s business operations, Sarin is requesting a loan in the amount of $800 to rent four hectares of farmland for rice growing. By doing so, he would be able to generate more income to support the family. In the future, he would like to expand his agriculture business by purchasing two hectares of farmland for growing even more rice and to help his children get their bachelor degrees. Moreover, he plans to enlarge and strengthen their house to provide better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to rent four hectares of farmland for rice growing purposes

loans.name: Crema

texts.en: Crema is now seeking her 19th loan. Specifically, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 28,000 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase additional goods to sell in her variety store. The shell crafting business that she previously funded through NWTF and KIVA loans continues to provide Crema and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Davaasuren

texts.en:
Mr. Davaasuren is a 51-year-old man living with him family in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

He is an accountant, but for the past three years he has operated a taxi to earn a living. Lately, his taxi has been operating poorly because its core parts are damaged. Therefore, he has decided to fully repair his car, which he believes will allow him to generate an increase in profits in the future. The loan proceeds he is seeking will be dedicated to purchasing spare parts for his car.

loans.use: To repair his taxi by purchasing additional spare parts.
